loans.name: Regent Street Sellers Group

texts.en:
Assiatu is a 30-year-old business woman. She is a member of “Regent Street Sellers" solidarity group. “Regent Street Sellers” solidarity group has four members, three women and one man. (see group picture, Assisatu is on the right)

Assiatu has been in the rubber bowl business for the past 2 years. She opens her business six days a week from 9 am to 6 pm.

Assiatu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays for school, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.

Assiatu and her group members need a total of 4,000,000 SLL of which Assiatu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy dozens of rubber bowls for her business.
She still hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Assiatu is married and has two children age eighteen and fifteen, both school-going.

Assiatu and her group members thank you for supporting them.

loans.use: to buy dozens of rubber bowls for her business.

loans.name: Tinovimbanaye Group

texts.en:
In these unforgiving times, when the level of competition in terms of every trade is now very intense, vision and persistence are needed. Ottilia is sailing smoothly despite the rough winds that she at times faces. She is a 35-year-old married mother of 3 children. She resides in Kuwadzana 5, a high density suburb in Harare, Zimbabwe.

Her place of operation is strategically set since it is the center of a bigger suburb called Kuwadzana. Affectionately known as little “Messina”, Kuwadzana is tremendously busy and is a cash cow area for most businesses. People from all walks of life, different races and different classes all mix and mingle at the location.

Ottilia identified that her business would perform better in such an area and was fortunate enough to be allocated a table there by the authorities. She restocked some clothes and shoes from the little savings she had and proceeded to start a business. She was however not satisfied with the state of her business. She successfully applied for a 1st loan of $250 in October 2014. With that amount she restocked baby sandals, plastic sandals, stockings, towels and some adult sandals. Her group members who are cross border also help her out by restocking school shoes and school satchels on her behalf from South Africa.

Her business grew magnificently to everyone’s amusement and her table attracted many customers because it was well stocked and the products were just irresistible as they were so eye-catching. Her sales rose dramatically and this enabled her to repay their loan on a timely basis. She bought a wheel barrow and managed to do some repairs at her table from the profits from her first loan.

Currently Ottilia has applied for a loan of $500 and intends to start crossing the border to South Africa so as to restock clothes, shoes and sandals for the festive season. She also intends to start operating at another flea market that is located in the central business district of Harare. She stated that she has a vision to even restock from Tanzania and is hoping that with the help of Thrive she will be able to fulfill that vision.

loans.use: to start crossing the border to South Africa to restock clothes, shoes and sandals for the festive season.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is a married and has been blessed with four school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years she has operated a farming business, selling as retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Alimatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de cinq femmes a été crée depuis le 01/12/2008.Il regroupe des femmes issues du même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations de voisinages et professionnelles.
Madame Aminata est la responsable elle est âgée 54 ans mariée et mère de trois filles. elle est assise à gauche de la photo la main levée.Madame s'active dans le commerce par la vente de tissus divers et dispose d'une bonne expérience.Avec son nouveau crédit de 350 000 francs CFA elle va se payer des balles de tissus divers destinés à la vente au détail au niveau de son quartier.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaire de ses enfants et de renforcer son capital pour la bonne marche de son activité.
texts.en:
This five-woman group was created on 1st December 2008. It is made up of women who live in the same local area and who know each other through their communities and their professional networks.

Aminata, the leader of this group, is a 54-year-old married mother to three daughters. She is the woman sat with her hand raised to the left of the photo. She earns a living through selling various fabrics and has a lot of experience in this area.

With this 350,000 FCFA loan, she wants to purchase quantities of various fabrics which she will then resell in her local area. The profits she earns will allow her to pay for her children's food, as well as their school and health fees. She will also be able to strengthen her working capital and thereby continue to successfully run her business.

loans.use: to purchase various fabrics.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita, 32 years old, is married and has three children aged 14, 10 and nine. Many years ago, she established her grocery shop business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods. In the future, she plans to uplift her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.


In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a single mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Market Ladies Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu is a member of Market Ladies solidarity group (see group picture, Rugiatu stands in the middle). She sells food and has been doing so for the past three years. She uses proceeds of her business to provide livelihood for her family and to increase the business.

Rugiatu and other group members of Market Ladies solidarity group are requesting for their first loan. Rugiatu and her group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000SLL. Of this amount, Rugiatu will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase one carton of chicken, 1 rubber cooking oil, fish, pepper, onions, etc for her business.

Rugiatu is 31-years-old, married and has two children. Rugiatu hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to be independent and to build a dwelling house.

Rugiatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses

loans.use: to purchase one carton of chicken, 1 rubber cooking oil, fish, pepper,

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman and owns a house that has water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

Florence has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes men and women's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, pero en su casa solo vive con dos hijos.

Rosa, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, debido a que no pudo estudiar sus padres la mandaron a trabajar para que les ayudara con los gastos de su familia; desde hace 3 años ella decidió colocar una pequeña granja de pollos de engorde, para darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de que estudien.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar 200 pollos y para comprar concentrado para ellos, ella quiere aprovechar la temporada navideña, porque en esta época se venden más los pollos. 

Rosa, sueña con ver a su hijos graduándose de una universidad y también desea realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old. She went to school until fourth grade. She is a single mother and has three children, but she lives in her home with only two children. 

Rosa has engaged in household chores since she was a girl. Because she could not study, her parents sent her to work in order to help with the family expenses. Three years ago she decided to put in place a small farm of broilers to give her children the opportunity to study. 

Rosa needs a loan to buy 200 chicken and concentrate for them. She wants to take advantage of the Christmas season because more chickens are sold during this time.

Rosa dreams of seeing her children graduating from college and would also like to make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens and concentrate for them.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 25 years old. She is married and lives in the Kutaisi District with her family. Ekaterine is unemployed and wants to open a clothes shop in order to generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 5,000 GEL.

With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes and will open a clothes shop. She will work there as a sales lady and will generate income. Ekaterine hopes that this business will be successful and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a clothes shop

loans.name: Garikai Group

texts.en:
When Tsitsi’s husband left Zimbabwe for greener pastures in South Africa, his departure was seen as a much needed lifeline to their family which was living with poverty at their doorstep. Tsitsi envisioned a brighter future for her and her son once her husband settled and started sending money home. Alas this was not to be. Her husband abandoned her and their five-year-old boy. He decided to start a new life for himself and forgot about his responsibilities back home. At the time, their accommodation comprised of a one room structure without windows where they had to use plastic instead of glass.


In time, she realized that if she was to keep holding onto her grief, it would not help improve the situation, worse still the welfare of her child. With help from her family, she started a poultry business which has been running for about a year and a half now. From the income she is generating, her life has begun to take shape once again.


Tsitsi is aged 31 and stays with her young son. She is a doting mother who wants to make sure that her child gets a decent education. He has since started going to a local school in their suburb. She has extended their home and they now have two rooms with a toilet and a bathroom.


Other women in her community recognized a good friend and pillar in Tsitsi. They saw her as a hard worker and someone they can work with in improving for their families' lives. They linked up with her to form the group Garikai group (a Shona which translates to “living a good life”). She and her group members religiously attended trainings offered at Thrive and they have learned good ways of running their businesses through financial trainings.


Tsitsi realises that her business is still in the growth phase. For her to sustain her profits as well as to preserve her capital, she wishes to extend her fowl run and increase the number of chicken batches she keeps at a time. This would require an additional working capital of $400 in the medium term. With a Kiva loan, Tsitsi can be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to extend her fowl run and increase the number of chicken batches she keeps at a time.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
40-year-old Lalita is married and has 2 children, aged 24 and 21. Many years ago, Lalita established her grocery shop business. She works 7 days a week and 12 hours a day to support her family. Lalita has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods. In the future, Lalita plans to improve her family's economic conditions. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Gs Fraternidad Group

texts.es:
El Señor German tiene 67 años de edad, es padre de 1 hijo, convive con su compañera de hogar, habita en la Aldea de Las Vegas de Veracruz, Su actividad principal es la caficultura, donde cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad y su finca es plantacion nueva  por la cual espera producir mas que el año pasado, y tambien se dedica a la agricultura, de la cual entran ingresos continuamente para hacerle frente a sus obligaciones cotidianas.
Don German sueña mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y con este credito que solicita podra obtener una planta solar sueño que ha tenido desde hace tiempo el cual se hara realidad por que con una planta solar le cambiara la forma de vivir, y se le hara realidad con  el apoyo de la  Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA.los demas integrantes se dedican a la caficultura, cultivo de platano y agricultura lo integran: Orlin Daniel y Leila Elisabeth.


                                                             Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre 2015
texts.en:
German, 67, has one son and lives with his partner. He resides in the village of Las Vegas de Veracruz.

His primary job is coffee-growing and he has a lot of experience with it. His property is newly planted and he hopes to produce more than last year. He also makes a living in agriculture, which provides him with a steady income to put toward his daily responsibilities.

German dreams of bettering living conditions for his family. With this loan, he will be able to fulfill his long-time dream of getting solar panels and changing his way of life. With the support of Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras and Kiva, his dream will become a reality.

The other members in the group, Orlin Daniel and Leila Elisabeth, make a living in coffee-growing, banana farming and agriculture.





Trojes, Honduras - November 2015

loans.use: buy 80-watt solar panels for his home.

loans.name: Conselata

texts.en:
Conselata is 45 years old and supporting eight people in her family.

She sells cereals, a business that she has been doing for the last 2 years and gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 30,000 in which she bought sacks of rice, white sugar, washed sugar, and cooking oils and sell wholesale or retail to customers in her store.

Up to this date, Marites income has increased and business is doing well, and she was able to pay her loan on time and still gain an income for her everyday family expenses.

Also Marites expanded her business and added a cooked food menu beside her store which is starting to gain customers.

Marites wanted to request another loan amounting to PhP 30,000 to buy groceries like canned goods, cooking oils, soft drinks, coffee, and other items as additional stock to her store to continuously improve her business and increase her income.

Marites still wants to sustain her improving store to help pay for her rent to own her home and most importantly for her children to finish their education.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice, white sugar, washed sugar, and more cooking oils which she sells wholesale or retail to customers in her store.

loans.name: Trust P. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Paul. He is the Managing Director of Trust Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Maluku in Mbale with 800 students. Trust P. School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Trust P. School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Paul ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Naftali

texts.en:
Naftali is 35 years old, married to Racheal and blessed with one child of 9 years old.

He is a malimali dealer in Kericho town. He has been in this business for almost three years and earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES.

This is his third loan with VisionFund Kenya having successfully repaid the previous loans. He intends to buy more bales of malimali for resale in the market. He anticipates helping his wife to open a business from the expanded business profits.

He dreams to buy a matatu (minibus) to help him in transportation.

loans.use: To purchase bales of malimali items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 35-year-old mother from Kisumu city, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She is married to Opar who also does business to support the family. They have been blessed with two children who are 11 and 13 years old.

She has a retail shop where she sells auto spare parts, a business she has been doing for the last eight years and generates a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

Florence has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy more stock of spare parts for sale. She will use the anticipated income to take her children to school and boost the business too.

Her dream is to have a stable business so that she can support her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spare parts for sale

loans.name: Babelyn

texts.en:
Babelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Babelyn is 31 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Babelyn has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. Babelyn requested a PHP 13500 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Babelyn has been in this business for 7 years. Babelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been dealing in secondhand clothes for four years now. He used savings that he got from agriculture to start the business he is operating now. He desires to have a diversified business dealing in different products like shoes and both new and secondhand clothes.

As he prepares for the festive season, he would like to stock up on clothes to sell, because customers increase during such a season. However, he does not have enough capital at hand to do so. Therefore, Francis is requesting credit to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With this loan, Martha wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Majory

texts.en:
Majory is a single woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Raise Up A Child School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joshua. He is the Head teacher of Raise Up a Child Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Namungoona in Kampala with 200 students. Raise Up a Child School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Raise Up a Child School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Joshua ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26, single and has a small sanitation facilities and ceramic tiles sales project.

He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy new ceramic tile designs, tabs, and plumbing spare parts.

loans.use: To buy new ceramic tile designs, tabs, and plumbing spare parts.

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis De Ayarmaca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal "SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS DE AYARMACA", ubicado en el poblado de Ayarmaca, en el distrito de Chinchero, en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento del Cusco.
La socia Alejandrina se dedica a la ganadería, ella cría vacas y ovejas. Ella tiene 40 años y es casada, con su actividad ganadera, ella aporta en su hogar y saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Alejandrina es trabajadora y dedicada a su labor, su sueño es tener una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor futuro para su familia.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar heno, necesario para la alimentación de sus animales.

Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales menores, al negocio de restaurante y a brindar servicios de maestro de construcción.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "San Francisco de Asis de Ayarmaca" communal bank, located in the village of Ayarmaca in the district of Chinchero, Urubamba province and department of Cuzco.

Alejandrina works in livestock and she raises cows and sheep. She is 40-years old and married. With her livestock job, she contributes in her home and supports her family. Alejandrina is a hard-worker and dedicated to her work. Her dream is to have a better quality of life and a better future for her family. She is asking for a loan to buy hay needed to feed her animals.

The other members work in agriculture, raising small animals, in the restaurant business and loaning master construction services.

loans.use: to buy hay.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El socio Antonio  pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, él socio continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de repuestos de automóviles, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, el socio sigue vendiendo repuestos de automóviles a sus clientes que le solicitan como parabrisas, timones, faros, guardafangos entre otros, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita le crédito para parabrisas y guardafangos entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner Antonio belongs to the community bank “Todos Unidos.” He continues to make a living selling automotive parts.

He has spent a good amount of time at his business, which goes well thanks to the efforts he puts in each day. His customers continually request parts from him, such as windshields, steering wheels, headlights, and fenders, among others. The partner wants to be able to continue working so he can support his family.

He is asking for the loan for windshields and fenders, among other things.

loans.use: to buy windshields and fenders, among other things.

loans.name: Narilen

texts.en: Narilen is a 39-year-old mother of three. She works hard to provide for her children, so they can have a good life. She is into making suman - snacks made from sticky rice, mixed with milk and sugar, wrapped in banana leaves and steamed. She also cooked dish to sell. Whatever she cooked for a meal food, she usually have it packed in small portions for easy distribution and selling. Most of the time she sell sauteed vegetables and noodles. She is asking a loan to buy more sticky rice, sugar and vegetables. Narilen has high hopes that her children can finish their schooling through her business.

loans.use: to  buy sticky rice, sugar and vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old, widowed, and blessed with three children between the ages of 4 to 12 years old. She has been selling secondhand clothes for 11 years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

With her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, she intends to purchase secondhand clothes to sell to her customers in the village. She plans to save money to pay for school fees for her children with her increased business profits.

Her dream is for her children to get a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a  good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar,soap, flour, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will boost her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Alh. Usman

texts.en:
Alhaji Usman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Usman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Usman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Usman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Usman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Usman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing to eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices during harvest.

loans.name: Erisa School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sarah. She is the Head teacher of Erisa Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mbale with 300 students.

Erisa School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Erisa School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sarah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Philorah

texts.en:
Philorah is married and has been blessed with four school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a farming business, selling her produce from home and at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

Philorah decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this KES 8,500 she wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Sharp Children's Centre

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Mercy. She is the Head teacher of Sharp Children's Centre, a mixed school in the urban area of Musita in Mbale with 700 students. Sharp Children's Centre has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Sharp Children's Centre will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Mercy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.en:
Rumbidzai is a 25-year-old cross border trader. She is a member of the Emmanuel group, meaning “God is with us". She started her business in July of 2014. Rumbidzai initially got her inspiration from the Youth Guidance Expo that was conducted at her church. She recalls being told, “Don’t be ashamed of your story, it will inspire others”. Prior to the guidance expo, she used to look down on herself, but now she now thinks positively of herself and what she can achieve.

Rumbidzai raised $60 to apply for a passport through her hair dressing business. She also joined a five-member savings and loans group where she started saving on a regular basis. When it was her turn to get a loan, she traveled to Messina, South Africa where she started to buy clothes, shoes, and household goods for resale back home.

Rumbidzai now runs both her hair dressing and resale businesses. Before she attended training at Thrive, she only recorded her stock levels, restocking costs, and debts; now, she is also capable of keeping daily record sheets. She has also learned the importance of group work as her group members share ideas and help each other. Rumbidzai is requesting $200 to expand the range of goods she can buy and sell to boost her business.

In the next 5 years, Rumbidzai hopes to open a clothing boutique and a salon of her own. She also hopes to be a role model in her community in order to change other peoples’ lives through motivation.

loans.use: to expand the range of goods she can buy and sell to boost her business.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en:
Buhari is maize farmer from Dan Gagci village. As a member of Babban Gona, Buhari is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Buhari would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Buhari can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Buhari is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis juillet 2011,rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le commerce et l'élevage.

Awa qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 50 ans,est veuve et mére de 08 enfants dont 04 garçons.

Son activité principale est l'élevage et comme activité secondaire elle pratique le commerce de céréales.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 01 mouton à 25000f,02 sacs de mil à 7500f le sac,100kg d'arachide à 250f le kg.

Le bénéfice est réservé à la nourriture et aux frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was set up in July 2011, assembled from members who live in the same village and have as an activity business and livestock farming. Awa, who is found at the far right of the photo and raising her arm, is the head and representative of the group.

She is 50 years old, widowed, and the mother of 8 children, of which 4 are boys. Her main activity is livestock farming and as a secondary activity she has a grain business. With the loan, she will buy 1 sheep, for 25,000 francs, 2 bags of millet, for 7,500 francs per bag, and 100kg of peanuts, for 250 francs per kg. The profit is reserved for food and health expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and some grains.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 25 years old and is selling second hand clothes in Busia, Kenya.

She is a mother of one whose spouse provides them with additional income. For the last two years she has been in this business and doing well.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase dresses, shirts and trousers for resale.

With the anticipated profit, she will be able to repay her loan as well as plough money back into her business.

She hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, shirts and trousers for resale

loans.name: Phanise

texts.en:
Phanice is 48 years old and supports eight people in her family. She has a retail shop, a business she has been doing for the last 20 years and gets a monthly income of KES 10,500.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.es:
Nancy Patricia con 20 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge y su hija, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 01 años. Solicita préstamo para dar mantenimiento a su carrito sanguchero el cuál se está deteriorando, el cuál le generará mayores ingresos diarios a su unidad familiar.

Nancy Patricia no cuenta con experiencia crediticia en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Nancy Patricia is 20-years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives in a house with her partner and daughter in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province and department of Lambayeque in Peru. She has very good personal and work references from the people in the area. The people who live there work mainly in agriculture, business and livestock.

She works selling hamburgers with an experience in the field of more than 1 year. She is asking for a loan to do maintenance on her sandwich cart which is deteriorating. This will get her a better daily income for her family.

Nancy Patricia does not have credit experience with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her sandwich cart.

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, May Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing.  May Joy is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy more coffee, milk, sugar, and cups for her cafeteria business.

May Joy has sustained her business through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, milk, sugar, and cups for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a flower vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more flowers to sell to her customers.

Josephine has been in this business for 30 years now.

Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more flowers to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ownership Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 31-year-old business woman. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 8, one of whom attends school. She is a member of Ownership Solidarity Group, which has five members. Fatmata is shown in the middle of the group photo.

Nine years ago, Fatmata established her men's and women's clothing business. With the money she earns, she pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food for her children. She runs her business six days a week from 8am to 6pm.

The Ownership Solidarity Group is requesting a total loan of 7,500,000 SLL. Fatmata is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL, which she will use to buy cartons of men's and women's clothing to add to her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family.

In the future, Fatmata plans to save money to pay for her children’s university education. She believes that providing her children with a university education will better the lives of her entire family. Fatmata and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of men's and women's clothing and other items to add to her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 38 years old and married with children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a gift shop, which he started eight years ago. He started this business to boost the family income and desires to have a wholesale gift shop fully stocked to serve different people from within and outside his area, plus constructing a permanent residential dream house for his family.

Julius' biggest challenge is limited capital to meet his dream. At the moment he is focusing on constructing a house. Hence his request for credit to buy construction materials like stones and sand for building his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like stones and sand for building his house.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero y vive en casa junto a sus padres y sus hermanos.

Manuel, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, aprendió este oficio gracias su padre, porque cuando el regresaba de la escuela tenía que ir al campo a trabajar y en las temporadas de cortar café él también trabaja para obtener un ingreso extra; pero desde hace un año se ha dedicado también a la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde y para cuidarlos le ayuda su madre.

Manuel, necesita el préstamo para construir más grande la granja para comprar más pollos, si amplia más la granja cada semana comprará un promedio de 75 pollos, porque tiene varios clientes y hay momentos que se queda sin producto para entregarlo.

Manuel, sueña con poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manuel is 26-years old. He went to school until the 9th grade. He is single and lives in a house with his parents and siblings. Manuel has worked in agriculture since he was a boy. He learned this trade thanks to his father because when he used to come home from school he had to go to the field to work. In the season of harvesting coffee he also works to get an extra income, but a year ago he started working raising and selling boiler chickens as well and his mother helps him to take care of them.

Manuel needs the loan to build a larger farm and buy more chickens. If he increases the farm more each week he will buy an average of 75 chickens because he has many customers and there are moments where he is left without anything to give them. Manuel dreams of being able to finish construction on his house.

loans.use: to build a larger farm and buy more chickens.

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
Ce membre a adhéré au programme depuis juillet 2011,et s'active dans le commerce de céréales et de légumes.

Elle est âgée de 51 ans,est veuve et mére de 05 enfants dont 03 filles.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 400 kg d'arachide à 250f le kg, une tonne de mil pour 100000f,800kg de maïs à 125f le kg et des légumes pour 30000f.

Le bénéfice servira à acheter la nourriture pour ses enfants et assurer leurs frais médicaux
texts.en: This member has adhered to the program since July 2011 and has an active grain and vegetable business. She is 51 years old, widowed, and the mother of 5 children, of which 3 are girls. With the loan, she will buy 400 kilograms of peanuts at 250 francs per kilogram, a ton of millet for 100,000 francs, 800kg of corn at 125 francs per kg, and vegetables for 30,000 francs. The profit will be used to buy food for her children and ensure their medical fees.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, millet, corn, and grains.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Elena pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de auto partes de automóviles, la socia es un mujer emprendedora y responsable que espera mediante su  negocio obtener más ganancias en su negocio yd e esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de faros y parabrisas.
texts.en: Rosa Elena belongs to the "Todos Unidos" communal bank. She continues working in her business selling car parts. She is an entrepreneurial and responsible woman who hopes that through her business she gets more income and this way she can continue supporting her family. She feels thankful for the given loan and promises to comply with her established dues. She hopes to be able to continue working to keep supporting her family. She is asking for a loan to buy headlights and windshields.

loans.use: to buy headlights and windshields.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 24 years old and she supports 2 people in her family. She has sold ready-made clothes for the past 5 years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Leila has applied for her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to invest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oxford School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Alex. He is the Head teacher of Oxford High School, a mixed school in the rural area of Maluku in Mbale with 800 students. Oxford School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term as the expense of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Oxford School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Alex ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Everyline

texts.en:
Everyline is a widowed woman and has been blessed with two kids, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is school fees.

Everyline has operated a poultry selling business for more than 2 years. She cites disease outbreak, which causes losses, as a challenge to her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With her loan of 4,500 KES, Everyline wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en:
Olandina is 22 years old and married, with one  child. 

She is applying for a loan of $ 1.000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.  She has a shop, and she has been involved in her business activities since a few years ago.  She started it with her own working capital. 

She is earning a good income from selling her business because she is near many people. So she is still happy to do her business. 

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store, including sardines, detergent, soaps, biscuits, hand and body lotions, cooking oil, slippers, candles, hard drinks, and other things to sell. 

The framed photo is her son.

loans.use: To buy sardines, detergent, soaps, biscuits, hand and body lotion, cooking oil, slippers, candles, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Chandika

texts.en:
Chandika is 35 years old. She is married and has one child. Many years ago, she established her cow-raising business, where she works 7 days a week and 4 hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, She plans to improve her family's the economic conditions. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires. Also, methane from the dung can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Colobane Magasin-Pc2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en mai deux mille sept.C'est un groupe composé de femmes qui pratiquent le commerce. Madame Amy Collé qui est sur la photo, levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de vingt huit ans et mère d'une fille. Elle commercialise des poissons depuis deux ans. Elle compte avec ce crédit solliciter acheter des paniers de poissons qu'elle va vendre à ses clients. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The banc villageois which this group is a part of was inaugurated in May 2007. It's a group composed of women who practice business. Madame Amy Collé, who is raising her hand in the photo, is the representative of the group. She is married, 28 years old, and the mother of a daughter. She has been selling fish for two years. With this requested loan, she will be able to buy some baskets of fish that she will sell to her customers. The profits will serve to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 42 years old, married and has two children aged 21 and nineteen. In 2005 she established her grocery store. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she supports her family.

Shova has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Kiva's field partner Patan BPW and used her most recent loan of 50,000 NPR to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her pasal, or small grocery store.

loans.name: Gs San Luis Group

texts.es:
El Señor Walter tiene 38 años de edad, es padre de 4 hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar, habita en la Aldea de San luis de Yamales, Su actividad principal es la caficultura, donde cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad y su finca es plantacion nueva  por la cual espera producir mas que el año pasado, de la cual entran ingresos continuamente para hacerle frente a sus obligaciones cotidianas.
Walter su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con el credito que esta solicitando podra obtener la planta solar que tanto a soñado su familia, Este sueño que ha tenido desde hace tiempo se hara realidad y con una planta solar le cambiara la forma de vivir para hacer su sueño posible cuenta con el apoyo de la  Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y Kiva.
Los demas integrantes se dedican a la caficultura y Agricultura lo integran: Jose Esteban y Jose Guadalupe Quienes tambien sueñan tener energia en sus hogares para hacer una forma de vida mejor a sus familias.

                                                             Trojes, Honduras Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Walter is 38-years old. He is the father of 4 children and lives with his partner in a home. He lives in the village of San Luis de Yamales. His main job is in the coffee industry where he has a lot of experience in management of this work and his farm is new plantation. He hopes to produce more than last year, with revenues that continually come in to deal with the daily obligations.

Walter's dream is to improve his family's living conditions. With the loan that he is asking for, he will be able to get the solar plant that his family has always dreamed of. This dream that he has had for a long time will come true and a solar plant will change his way of living.

To make his dream come true he counts on the support of the micro finance Prisma de Honduras and Kiva. The other members work in the coffee industry and agriculture. They are: Jose Esteban and Jose Guadalupe, who also dream of having electricity in their homes to give their families a better way of life.

Trojes, Honduras October 2015

loans.use: to buy a solar plant of 80 Watts for his home.

loans.name: Kandialang Soce-Ps Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en mars deux mille deux. C'est un groupe composé de femmes solidaires qui exercent principalement le commerce. Madame Awa, qui est sur la photo levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de quarante cinq ans et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Elle est dans la vente de légumes et de petit déjeuner depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle compte avec le montant sollicité acheter une quantité importante de légume et de produits divers qu'elle va revendre au marché et à l'école. Les bénéfices vont servir à assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The banc villageois which this group is a part of was inaugurated in March 2002. It's a group composed of single women who principally practice business. Madame Awa, who is in the photo raising her hand, is the representative of the group.

She is married, 45 years old, and the mother of three children of which one is a girl. She has been selling vegetables and breakfast for more than 20 years. With the amount asked for, she will be able to buy a large quantity of vegetables and various products that she will resell at the market and at school. The profits will serve to ensure the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and various products.

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krihna Maya, 26 years old, is married and has one child. 

Many years ago, she established her construction business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she helps support her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood timber.  In the future, she plans to uplift her family's economic conditions. She thanks you for your suppor

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small construction store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Timbers are purchased daily for construction of buildings, roads and other construction work. Owners of small stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy timber for resale

loans.name: Rene Wildon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, él socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de auto partes y adornos de autos, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio continua vendiendo los repuestos de autos para sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso el socio espera poder continuar apoyando a su familia mediante su trabajo.
El socio solicita le crédito para la compa de retrovisores  entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rene is a member of the communal bak Todos Unidos. He is a committed member of the group. His business is selling auto parts and car ornaments and he has done this work for a long time. He is doing well thanks to the effort that he puts into his business everyday. He continues selling auto parts to customers who request his services. He is a responsible and hardworking person who hopes to continue to support his family by working.

He is requesting a loan to purchase rearview mirrors and other car parts. He is grateful for the loan that is granted to him and will comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rearview mirrors and other car parts.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 45 years old and she supports 8 people in her family. She has run a grocery store for the last 2 years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Caren has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock of assorted vegetables. She will use the anticipated profit to invest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted vegetables.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is 47 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She has sold milk for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

This is Rosebella's first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to buy a dairy cow and add stock to her milk business. She plans to buy more cows for milk production to increase her income with her expanded business profits.

Her dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and add stock to her milk business.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy con 34 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 08 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Eloy es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Eloy, 34, is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his partner and their children in the district of Cañaris, Ferreñafe Province, Lambayeque, in the country of Peru. Eloy has good personal and work references from his neighbors in the area. The people in this town mostly earn their livings in agriculture and livestock trading.

Eloy is a farmer, specifically cultivating coffee. He has 8 years of experience. He has requested this loan for the purchase of fertilizers and to invest in the maintenance of his farmland so that he can have higher yields.

Eloy is a recurrent partner with Edpyme Alternativa. He has managed his credit and repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and invest in the maintenance of his land

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Lina, one of Ruma's agents. She lives with her husband and her children in Bekasi, the satellite city located east of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.

As a housewife, she realized that she has to help her husband increase their income for their children's education, so she is becoming an agent for Ruma. Right now she is selling mobile airtime credits for her community. These customers are getting familiar with mobile phones and internet – which is a good thing.

As the demand for transactions increases, Lina is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends.

In the photo, Lina is the woman standing with her husband and one of her daughters. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Joy S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is George. He is the Principal of Joy Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Maluku, in Mbale, with 400 students.

Joy Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean, drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean, drinking water and, therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will, therefore, save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean, drinking water for the students every day.

Joy Secondary School will repay its loan from its school fees, which it collects each term. George ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean, drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nema 2 Junior-Pc1 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en mai deux mille sept. Il est constitué de femmes qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce. Madame Hélène qui est sur la photo, levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente quatre ans et mère de deux enfants dont une fille. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plus de dix ans. Elle compte avec le prêt solliciter des sacs de légumes. Les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The banc villageois which this group is a part of was inaugurated in May 2007. It was formed of women who are principally active in business. Madame Hélène, who is raising her hand in the photo, is the representative of the group.

She is married, 34 years old, and the mother of two children of which one is a girl. She has been active in the sale of vegetables for more than 10 years. With this requested loan, she will be able to buy bags of vegetables. The profits will serve to meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a 31-year-old, Lebanese married woman who is living with her husband. She is a housewife where she is dedicated from her home and family. Her husband is the main income provider; he owns a small paint shop in his town.

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay the school registration fees for her nephew. She said that this loan will surely help her to insure the school year for him. That makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay the school registration fees for her nephew.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La socia Lizbeth pertenece al banco comunal “Todos Unidos”, la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio  de venta de auto partes, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, la socia espera mediante su negocio poder continuar apoyando a su familia ,la socia vende lo que son oparabrisas,faros,retrovisores entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra retrovisores entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Lizbeth belongs to the communal bank "Todos Unidos." She remains in the business of selling car parts. Lizbeth is a hardworking and responsible woman. She conducts her business to continue supporting her family. She sells windshield wipers, headlights, mirrors, and other car parts for her customers who request these parts. She has put a lot of time into her business which is doing well thanks to her daily efforts. This is the manner by which she supports her family.

Lizbeth requested a loan to purchase rearview mirrors and other car parts. She is grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rearview mirrors and other parts

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Lilian is 25 years old poultry farmer at Kisumu Kenya. She is a mother of one whose spouse provides with additional income.

For the last two years she has been selling retail household goods and it has been doing well.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, she will use the loan to purchase feeds for her poultry.

With the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her poultry

loans.name: Teodorica

texts.en: Teodora is a 41-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is a married woman with three children; they are 17, 13 and 5 years old. To earn a living, she runs a small sari-sari (variety) store while her husband does farming. Teodora wants to expand her business in the future for her children’s education. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as drinks, coffee, sugar, biscuits, biscuits, bread, candies, spices and toiletries. In this way, she will be able to improve her store.

loans.use: to buy drinks, coffee, sugar, biscuits, biscuits, bread, candies, spices and toiletries

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 51 years old and has two children. Edna is married and has one child still in school.

Edna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Edna has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Maria Diocylin

texts.en:
Maria Diocylin is 51 years old and has six children. Maria Diocylin is married and has six children are currently in school.

Maria Diocylin is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria Diocylin requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maria Diocylin has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Diocylin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Babangida

texts.en:
Babangida is a maize farmer from Makera village. As a Babban Gona member he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Babangida would have had to sell his maize at harvest time when the price of maize is at its lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member he can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for it at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to a loan of 24,082 NGN and the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Babangida no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at a low price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, he hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time and sell it later at a higher price.

loans.name: Alhaji Iliyasu

texts.en:
Alhaji Iliyasu is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. He is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Iliyasu would have had to sell his maize at harvest time when the price of maize is at its lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member he can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for it at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to a loan of 21,915 NGN and the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji Iliyasu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2000 USD per hectare of land, Alhaji Iliyasu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time, then sell it later at a higher price.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel es una mujer soltera y muy trabajadora. Estudió la licenciatura en derecho. Tiene 36 años y vive actualmente en Hermosillo, en donde tiene su negocio.
Hace dos años, se inició en la venta de joyería y bisutería fina por catálogo, con el fin de tener un ingreso extra para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Tras varias ventas, Anabel se dio cuenta que los productos que vendía gustaban a la gente y aprovechó la oportunidad de establecerlo como su trabajo. Con el fin de ganar más dinero, también comenzó a vender joyería de distintos diseñadores con el objetivo de formalizar, en un futuro, su negocio de bisutería.
Con este fin y el de poder crear una cartera de clientes más amplia para poder incrementar sus ventas, Anabel ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar más mercancía y así tener la oportunidad de ofrecer más diseños y productos a sus clientes.
Con este crédito, Anabel ha tenido la oportunidad de tener una mejor solidez económica y estar más cerca del sueño de crear un negocio formar.
texts.en:
Anabel is a single, hardworking woman. She has a degree in law. She is 36 and lives in Hermosillo, where she runs her business.

Two years ago, she began selling jewelry and costume jewelry by catalog in order to earn extra income and improve her quality of life. After several sales, Anabel realized that people loved the products she sold so she took to opportunity to make this her job. To earn more money, she began selling various jewelry designs. Her future goals is to formalize her jewelry business.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and have the opportunity to sell more designs and products to customers in order to create an increase in her sales portfolio. With this loan, Anabel has the opportunity to have better economic resilience and will be closer to her dream of a formalized business.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to offer more designs and products to her customers

loans.name: Nema 2 Junior-Pc2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois qui abrite ce groupe a été inauguré en mai deux mille sept. C'est un groupe composé de femmes qui développent l'activité commerciale. Madame Victorine qui est sur la photo, levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est célibataire, quarante ans et mère de deux enfants dont un garçon. Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de dix ans. Elle compte, avec ce prêt, acheter des légumes et de la boisson qu'elle va revendre à ses clients. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en: The 'banc villageois' that accommodates this group was started in May 2007. It is a group made up of women who are developing small businesses. Victorine who is in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is is 40 years old, single, and the mother of two children, one of whom is a boy. She has had her business for over ten years. With this loan, she intends to buy vegetables and drinks which she will resell to her customers. The profits will help her take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and drinks.

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati is 45 years old. She is married and has two children ages 24 and 17. In 2004, she established her hardware store. Working seven days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy painting colors for her store. In the future, Bhagawati plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small hardware store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Colors for painting, nails, and different hardware necessary for household use are purchased daily. Owners of small hardware stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy painting colors.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en: Saffa is a 24 year old Lebanese single woman who lives with her parents and her brother. Her father and mother cooperates together with the aim to ensure them a heavy life. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the school registrations fees. She is very ambitious and he intends to study harder to obtain high grades.

loans.use: to pay her school registrations fees.

loans.name: Micaela Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Micaela continua negocio de venta de lencería, ropa de baño, medias, fajas entre otros, la socia es una mujer responsable y empeñosa la socia espera mediante su trabajo obtener mas ganancias para de esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continuar viendo medias, ropas interiores para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa interior para damas entre otros.
texts.en:
Micaela continues selling lingerie, swimwear, hosiery, belts, and other clothing. She is a responsible and earnest woman who hopes that her work will allow her to earn more income and support her family. She sells stockings and underwear for men, women, and children. She sells her products to customers who request them and supports her family through this business.

She is requesting a loan to buy women's underwear and other products.

loans.use: to purchase women's underwear and other clothing

loans.name: Santos Mariano

texts.es:
Santos Mariano con 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a s cónyuge, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Santos Mariano es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo canceló de forma puntual.
texts.en:
