Santos Mariano is 45 years old, is in a legal union, and lives in his own house made of rustic material, together with his spouse, in the district of Cañaris, province of Ferreñafe, department of Lambayeque, in the country of Peru. He has many good references, as many personal as work-related, from the people of the area. The inhabitants of this region primarily work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

He devotes himself to agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee, with 10 years of experience in the field. He is asking for a loan to buy manure and to invest in the maintenance of his farm in order to get a greater yield.

Santos Mariano is a recurrent partner with Edpyme Alternativa. He has managed his credit and repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy manure and to invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a 29 year old supporting 8 people in his family.

He has a money transfer shop, a business he has been doing for the last 3 years and gets a monthly income of Kes 35,000.

He has applied for his third loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to increase his working capital by getting more float to cater for his increasing customers.

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to increase his working capital by getting more float to cater for his increasing customers

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 50 years old and married.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Bella has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from clothing retail.

Bella aspires to Save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is 24 years old and he lives with his parents and brother in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. His father and mother work at the private company, his brother works at the school. Gegham has vocational education and now he works at the market as a cashier and salesman.

Gegham has great request and he is so hopeful that it will be accepted. His father has some health problems now and lack of finance makes Gegham very upset since he is very worried about his father’s health state. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams this young man asks for the solution of his father’s health problem as soon as it is possible.

loans.use: find the solution of his father’s health problem as soon as possible.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 25 years old and she’s from a town called Choma in the southern province of Zambia. She is currently studying at one of the open universities and is due to complete her studies in December. To support herself through university, Caroline has been running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. She works hard to be of service to people in her community. Caroline’s main challenge is that she struggles with her cash float, as she needs to see to the family’s basic needs. Also, her profit margins are low due to the fact that she does not have enough float in her business to serve customers who need to transact large sums of money. This has a negative impact on the business, as she loses out on profit.

Caroline is requesting her first Kiva loan in order to increase her capital base, so that she can serve customers who need to transact larger sums of money and earn more profits. The loan will also be used to purchase a trading a kiosk, so that her location can be more visible and attract more customers. Earning more profits will make life much easier. Caroline’s hopes and dreams are to be the best Zoona mobile money transfer provider and expand to more locations. She is eager to improve her business and pay back her loan. She says this business gives her hope for the future, and she appreciates the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a trading kiosk and increase her capital base, so that she can serve customers who need to transact larger sums of money.

loans.name: Rocío Guadalupe

texts.es:
Rocío es una mujer trabajadora que vive en el Estado de México, lugar donde también se encuentra su negocio. Tiene 51 años, está casada y es madre de dos hijos, de 22 y 17 años de edad. 
Rocío es una mujer que ha sabido ahorrar su dinero y hace seis años, tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir traspaso de una tienda miscelánea y decidió aprovecharla.
Actualmente, su tienda es próspera y le da el sustento que necesita para sacar adelante sus gastos y ayudar a su familia. Consciente de su competencia y con la idea de más adelante poder iniciar otro negocio, Rocío ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar mercancía y que de esa manera sus ingresos y ventas aumenten.
Rocío encuentra la motivación que necesita para salir adelante con su negocio, en el amor que siente por su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rocío is a hard working women who lives in the State of Mexico, where her business is also found. She is 51 years old, is married and is mother of two children, 22 and 17 years old. 

Rocío is a woman who has managed to save money and six years ago had the opportunity to acquire the transfer of a corner store and decided to take advantage of it. 

Currently, her store is thriving and provides the support that she needs to get ahead of expenses and help her family. Aware of the competition and with the idea later on to to start another business, Rocío has requested a loan to buy merchandise and thus increase income and sales. 
Rocío finds the motivation needed to get ahead with her business in the the love she feels for her work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and thus increase income and sales

loans.name: Jacquline

texts.en:
Jacquline is a married  mother of three children, whom all attend school. She lives at a rental house that  has electricity but no  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Jacquline operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her villages. She faces a major challenge of transportation  in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and pay for transport

loans.name: Mbolatiana Marina

texts.fr:
Mbolatiana Marina vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé dernièrement. Avec lequel, elle a pu augmenter les stocks des produits à vendre  et a pu constituer des épargnes supplémentaire avec les bénéfices générés. De ce fait, elle a pu réaliser son rêve d'étendre sa maison d'habitation. Elle est encours de finition. Le développement de l'activité petit à petit ne cesse pas et la réalisation des objectifs sur le plan social aussi s'en suit.
L'ouverture d'un deuxième point de vente sera pour bientôt si ce nouveau prêt va lui être accordé et elle envisage aussi d'acheter d'autre terrain et construire d'autre maison qui va être mise en location pour améliorer le revenu.
texts.en: Mbolatiana Marina thanks you very much for the loan that you granted to her recently. With that loan, she was able to increase her stock of products to sell and was able to form some supplementary savings with the profit generated. Because of this, she was able to realize her dream of extending her house. It is awaiting completion. The development of the activity little by little does not stop and the realizations of objectives of redundancy plans are also being followed. A second point of sale will be opening soon if this new loan is granted to her. She also plans to buy another plot and build another house which will be in a location to improve revenue.

loans.use: to buy sheets and quilts.

loans.name: Mamitahina Herilanja

texts.fr:
Mamitahina est un homme travailleur et dynamique de 30 ans, il est marié et sa femme de 32 ans l’appuie dans l'exercice ses activités. 
Mamitahina a comme activité la production et la commercialisation de nems, sambos et jus , produits de la pâtisserie.  L’activité nécessite des matériels adéquats pour  une production de bonne qualité.  
L’exploitation se situe à son domicile. Il dispose de 11 revendeurs qui font la livraison des produits aux clients fixes. L’idée de l’extension de l’activité est née suite à une formation en pâtisserie qu’il a suivi au mois de Septembre 2015. C’est lui qui assure la préparation et cuisson des produits, sa femme s’occupe de la vente.  
Le couple a deux enfants ( 10-5 ans ) scolarisés.  Leur projet à court terme est de chercher un point de vente.
texts.en:
Mamitahina is a hardworking and energetic 30-year-old man. He is married and his 32-year-old wife helps him with his work.

Mamitahina makes and sells spring rolls, fruit drinks and juice, bakery items. The business needs adequate materials to make high quality products.

The operation is located in his house. He has 11 salespeople who deliver the products to regular customers. The idea to expand the business was hatched following a pastry school training which he took in September 2015. He is the one who takes care of the preparation and baking of the products. His wife is in charge of sales.

The couple has two children (10 and 5 years old) who are in school. Their short term goal is to look for a shopfront.

loans.use: to buy a window, an oven, and a used freezer.

loans.name: One Family Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is 39 years old and pictured third from the left. She is married and has five children aged 21, eighteen, fifteen, eleven and two years old. One child is in university while the others are in primary and secondary school. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Sixteen years ago Mariatu started selling groceries and drinks to support her children in their schooling. She works six days a week from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. With her profits she pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food for her children.

Mariatu’s six-member group has applied for a total loan of 14,500,000 SLL through Kiva's field partner ARD. As the leader of the group she is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL, which she will use to buy an additional four cartons of biscuits, sweets, milk, drinks, etc. for her store. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family so she can save more money to provide for her children’s university education.

Mariatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy an additional four cartons of biscuits, sweets, milk, drinks, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged seven and two years old. She has been into vegetable and dairy farming for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more vegetable seedlings, milking gallons, and dairy meals for resale in the village.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to help her husband in paying school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable seedlings, milking gallons, and dairy meals for resale in the village.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CALCA, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Calca y departamento  de Cusco.
La socia Felicia tiene 53 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de restaurante, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Felicia belongs to the Señor de Huanca de Calca communal bank, which is located in the province of Calca, in the Cusco section.

Felicia is 53 and married. She alternates her daily tasks with working at her restaurant business. She prepares different types of dishes that her clients ask for. She takes her time and puts in a lot of effort every day with her restaurant, which helps her support her family.

She is very grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments. She is asking for this loan to buy rice, oil, legumes and more.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, legumes and more.

loans.name: Wuni Songti Daafong No. 1 Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old, married woman living in Daafong, Karaga in the northern region of Ghana. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Mary is the woman standing at the back, with the hand raised, among her group mates in the photo. She belongs to a group of hardworking businesswomen in Karaga. The group is named ‘Wuni Songti Daafong No.1’ which means, God will help us group of Daafong, Karaga.

Mary is engaged in petty trading of assorted cooking oils and ingredients at the local market, with 10 years of experience in the business. She has two people working with her in the business. Mary and her group are challenged with inadequate capital to grow their businesses. They have therefore made a loan request of GHC 19,300. Mary’s share of the loan is GHC 1,000, which would be used to buy palm oil, peanut oil, groundnut paste, and other ingredients, to sell at the local market.

Mary dreams to become a supplier of her products to other retailers in her community. She wants to get a good income from business to pay off this loan, and also provide her children with their basic needs. Mary is very happy with the Grameen-Kiva partnership for helping to transform their lives. She thanks the lenders for their great support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, peanut oil, groundnut paste and other ingredients, to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Kuplin

texts.ru: Кулпин 47 летняя жительница района Кубадиен. Она замужем и имеет два сына. Сыновья находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине что они не нашли себе подходящую работу в стране. Кулпин на районе проживает вместе с мужем. Она вместе с мужем занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Кулпин на большой земле выращивает растение. Ее муж занят выращиванием домашних животных. Они помогает друг другу. Кулпин хочет отработать земельный участок минеральными удобрениями к новому посеву урожай. Она решила посадить пшеница и лук. Кулпин решила купли минеральных удобрений и семян урожай за счет кредита. С Вашей помощью она  закончить посев. Кулпин заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Kulpin is 47 years old and lives in the Qubadiyon region. She is married and has two sons. Her sons are currently in the Russian Federation as migrant workers because they were unable to find adequate work in their country. Kulpin lives with her husband. They do agricultural work together. Kulpin grows farm crops on a large field. Her husband raises livestock. They help each other. 

Kulpin would like to treat her land with mineral fertilizers before the new planting season. She will plant wheat and onions. Kulpin would like to receive a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. Thanks to your help she will be able to finish planting. Kulpin thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi, 49 years old, is married and has two children, aged 26 and 19. Many years ago, she established her construction business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy timber wood. In the future, she plans to uplift her family's economic conditions. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small construction store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Timber woods are purchased daily for construction of buildings, roads and other construction work. Owners of small stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 45 years old and supports eight people in her family. She sells cereals, a business she has been doing for the last two years and from which she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more cereals for resale. She will plow her anticipated profit back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Urugero Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine is a 42-year-old, married mother with three children. She has operated a beans and sorghum business for the past five years. She is the president of group URUGERO, and she is in front of others with papers in her hands. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Alphonsine is committed to her business so that her children may prosper.

Alphonsine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy a large quantity of beans and sorghum to sell. With this loan, she will earn more profits, which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, as well as pay her child's school fees and medical insurance, and to buy new clothes and shoes for her children. Over the next five years, as her business continues to grow, Alphonsine hopes to earn enough money to easily educate all of her children.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Miljury

texts.en:
Miljury is 41 years old and has six children. Miljury is married and has five children who are currently in school.

Miljury is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Miljury requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Miljury has been farming vegetables for 14 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Miljury would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 35 years old and has two children. Rosemarie is married and has two children who are in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jose Virgilio

texts.es: José, tiene 35 años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del municipio de la Campa Lempira. José siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijoles y hace 7 años comenzó a cultivar café, esta producción la vende en grano en el mercado de la zona o a intermediarios. El préstamo que solicita es por 20,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar materiales y pago de mano de obra para construir una pila para lavar el café que cosecha y venderlo lavado y seco, ya que así le queda mejor ganancia. Tiene como meta mejorar su finca y con las ganancias mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old, married, has one son and lives in the city of Campa Lempira. José has always worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans, but 7 years ago, he started growing coffee. He sells his produce in the local market or to intermediaries.

He is seeking a loan for 20,000 lempiras to purchase materials and to pay for labor to build a sink to wash his coffee in, in order to be able to wash and dry it before selling it. This way, he will make a greater profit. His goal is to improve his farm and home with his earnings.

loans.use: purchase materials and pay for labor to build a sink to wash the coffee.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan is a maize farmer from Dankala village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhassan is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Alhassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alhassan can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhassan no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Alhassan hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mallam Shehu

texts.en:
Mallam Shehu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Mallam Shehu would have had to sell his maize at a low price at harvest time to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support and a 21,915 NGN, he will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for it at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Mallam Shehu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his farm for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time, then sell it later at a higher price.

loans.name: Tininyitob-Tatale Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37 year old married woman and a mother of 3, living in Anyankrom, Tatale in Northern Ghana. Elizabeth is the woman seated with the hand raised in the photo. She is a seamstress, engaged in dress making. Elizabeth is a member of a group called ‘Tininyitob – Tatale’. Elizabeth has been in the business for nine years. She has three apprentices who are understudying and working for her.

Elizabeth is also engaged in selling of dried fish and sachet water in the community for complementary income. She and her group have a challenge in term of inadequacy of capital to operate effectively. As a result, they have requested a loan of GHC 14,000.00, out of which Elizabeth’s share is GHC 1,000.00. She intends to use part of her loan to buy sewing materials and the rest for sachet water for resale. Elizabeth wants to earn more income to pay off this loan and support her children’s education. Meanwhile she dreams to see her business grow for her to become independent of loans.
Elizabeth is very grateful for the support she and her group get from Kiva for which she thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and the rest for sachet water for resale.

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maya is 60 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 40 and 31. In 1995, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizers. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Indra Kumari

texts.en:
Indra Kumari is 33 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 10. In 2006, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent loan to buys seeds and pesticides. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (tarkari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a married woman who is 26 years old and has four children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband works very hard to be capable of covering their heavy expenses, in order to live a respectable life.

Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy the books and pay the registrations fees for her children for the school year. One of her greatest dreams is to see them achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to buy the books and pay the registrations fees for her children for the school year.

loans.name: Mayenkeneh Group

texts.en:
Bendu is a fifty-one year old business woman. She is a woman of “Mayenkeneh “solidarity group. The group has six members of three men and three women. (see group picture, Bendu is in the middle).
Bendu has been in clothing materials business since 1984 year. She opens her business six days a week from 8am to 6pm.
Bendu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business.

Bendu and her group members needs a total of 14,500,000 SLL of which Bendu is entitled to Le 2,500,000 SLL which she will use to buy additional 2 bales of cotton materials for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Bendu is married and has two children age twenty-seven and seven.

In the feature, Bendu plans to generate more money to provide for her children university education. She believes educating her children to university will better the lives of her family.
Bendu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional 2 bales of cotton materials for her business.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is 59 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 42. Many years, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizers. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two working children. Three years ago, and after being through difficult circumstances, she started to sell make up products in her house. And now, she states that she needs more make up tools and equipment which she will acquire by the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.  She is impatient to receive those funds hoping that it will help her improve her business as well as her way of living.

loans.use: have more make up tools and equipment.

loans.name: Mellon Sisters Group

texts.en:
Isatu is a member of Mellon Sisters Group. She is 56 years old and married with four children, ages 40, 32, 30, and 28 years old. All of them are school-going children. (See group picture; Isatu is in the middle.)

Isatu was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of the wealth of experience she has in managing people. Twenty years ago, Isatu established her charcoal and firewood business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells six days per week from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Isatu plans to use the loan to buy bags of garri (cassava flakes), charcoal, firewood, etc. for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account, which will be used in paying her children's school fees. Isatu and her group members need a loan totaling 9,500,000 SLL, of which Isatu is entitled to 3,000,000 SLL.

Isatu plans to give her children the best education, build a house, and live a happy life.

Isatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of garri, charcoal, firewood. etc. for resale.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer from Bazai village. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when its price is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yahaya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yahaya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking 33-year-old mother and wife from Lusaka, Zambia. She needs a loan in order to access working capital to enable her to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent.

As a Zoona mobile money transfer agent, Nancy’s business will provide financial services to people when they need it most. She will set up her business in the capital city Lusaka. With this loan, Nancy will procure a branded trading kiosk and have the funds needed to facilitate actual transactions. Nancy says setting up her own business will empower her so that she can contribute financially in the home so that she can make a better living for herself and her family.
Nancy is passionate about helping people in her community and is hopeful that by setting up her own business, she can make life easier for them by offering a service that is easy and safe to use.
Nancy’s dream is to one day earn enough money from the business to take herself to school so that she can get a degree in social work.

loans.use: to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer service provider in Lusaka, Zambia.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yau has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Yau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yau can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Yau will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yau is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Chapima Group

texts.en:
Tereza is 38 years old. She is married with 4 children and also provides for 3 orphans and one reletive in her home. Her husband is a builder.

Tereza is running a grocery and vegetable business. She intends to use this loan to buy more groceries such as sugar and soap as well as vegetables. The profits from the business will enable her to put food on the table and pay school fees for her children. She opted to start a business so she could become financially independent. She receives help with the daily activities of the business, from a family member and an employee.

Her plan is to buy a plot of land and build a house. She also hopes to expand her business to sell more things in her store such as maize flour and milk.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Madalitso Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, 35 years old, is married and has three children, two orphans and one relative that depend on her. Her husband works as a driver. Beatrice sells secondhand clothes for a living, and has employed one person to help with the running of the business.

Beatrice would like to use this loan to buy a bale of clothes to sell. She will use the profits from her sales to pay school fees for her children. Beatrice started her business to support her husband with their financial needs such as paying for school fees and household necessities. Beatrice plans to build a house for her family, to extend her business and to open shops in three different locations.

loans.use: to buy a bale of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Tifokibe-Anyakrom-Tatale Group

texts.en:
Abena is a 45-year-old married woman living in Anyankrom, Tatale in Northern Ghana. She has 4 children all of whom attend school. Abenan is the individual squatting in the middle with one hand in the supporting the measure of the grain in the basin. She is very active in the business of selling food stuff, in which she has been engaged for 23 years now. 
Abena belongs to a group of business minded women called ‘Tifokibe – Anyankrom, Tatale’. The group has requested for a loan of GHC 13,000.00 out of which Abena needs GHC 400.00 to buy grains for resale at the local market. She has a good customer base and intends to get funds to buy more cereals for business in order to get increased income. Abena wants to get more income to repay this loan and support her family. She dreams to become a wholesaler who would keep large volumes of food stuff in stock for real business.
Abena is happy with the opportunity to increase her business potential and thanks her lenders for that.

loans.use: to buy grains for resale at the community market.

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Radha, 42 years old, is married and has two children, 20 and 16 years old. Radha established her grocery store business in 2000. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Radha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 46 years old. She is married and has two children who are 28 and 26. In 1995, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.

In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Cresenciano

texts.es:
Cresenciano con 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Querocotillo,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de maíz, con una experiencia desde hace 15 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra para la realización de deshierbos en su cultivo de yuca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Cresenciano es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado 06 créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Cresenciano is 50 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and their two children in the district of Querocotillo in the province of Cutervo in Catamarca, Peru, which is a rural area. He has very good personal and professional references from the residents of this region. The residents of this area work primarily in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Cresenciano works in agriculture, specifically, growing corn. He has about 15 years of experience growing corn. He is seeking a loan to purchase supplies to weed his yucca crops. This way, he will be able to obtain greater profits. Cresenciano is a continuing member of Edpyme Alternative. He has receives 6 loans that he has paid off on time.

loans.use: purchase the necessary supplies to weed his yucca crops.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shehu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Shehu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Shehu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alasan

texts.en:
Alasan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alasan has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alasan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alasan can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alasan will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alasan is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fanah Market Group

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Adama. She is married with five children, four who are working and one who has graduated from the university. Adama belongs to a solidarity group of four women and one man, who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. “Fanah Market” is the name of Adama’s solidarity group. This group needs a total loan of 6,00,000 SLL. Adama will receive 2,000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase additional gallons of cooking oil, bags of dry pepper, groundnuts, rice, etc. for her business. See group picture Adama (is in the middle).

Adama established her foodstuff business in 1980; she established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs, especially her children. She uses profits from this business to provide livelihood for her family and to support her children’s education. She is a hardworking woman. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. In the future, Adama plans to support her children to acquire university education. She hopes to do more than what she is doing presently. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of cooking oil, bags of dry pepper, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en:
Usaini is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Usaini has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Usaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Usaini can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Usaini will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Paz Y Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
JULIA JULVIA, tiene 49 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "Paz y desarrollo" que está formado por seis socias.
hace cinco años, inició su negocio de venta de quesos, los cuales los trae de la provincia de Canta, inició vendiéndolo a sus conocidos, familiares, vecinos y amistades, poco a poco fue aumentando sus clientes, ahora reparte en mercados y tiendas.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de quesos para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: Julia Julvia is 49 years old. She is a member of the "Paz y Desarrollo" lending group, which is made up of six members. Five years ago, she started a business selling cheeses that she brings from the Canta province. She started selling to her acquaintances, relatives, neighbors and friends. Little by little, she began to accumulate customers and she now sells to markets and stores. She will use this loan to purchase more cheese so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: purchase cheeses to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 33 years old and married, and she has two daughters. She is the owner of the family house. Her husband is an employee at a big farm located at El Paloma. He works there from Monday to Saturday.

Vilma is a farmer too; she plants flowers and she goes to many fairs to offer her products. She also sells cattle, and she needs a loan to buy cattle. Vilma is healthy, so she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Limbanazo Group

texts.en:
Lucy is 58 years old. She is married with three children that depend on her. Her husband works as a lecturer.

Lucy owns a kitchen ware shop. She would like to buy more kitchen ware with this loan she has requested. The profits from the business will help her pay for daily necessities such as food. She started her business to become self dependent and to support her husband with their family's financial needs such as water and electricity bills as well as school fees for the children.

Lucy hopes to send her children to the University of Malawi and be able to pay school fees. In the coming years, she hopes  to move away from the current rented shop and build her own shop.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen ware to sell

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is maize farmer from Dan Gagci village. As a member of Babban Gona, Shehu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Shehu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en:
Bulus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bulus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bulus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Bulus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Bulus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Bulus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 32-year-old, mother of four. She is married and lives in the northern province of Zambia. Three of her children go to school and one is 2 years old. She studied chemical technology and was a full-time employee at one of the mines, working as a lab technician from 2009-2012.

Today, Beatrice would like to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. She is driven, but does not having any means of accessing capital to start her business, which makes things difficult for her. Beatrice has dreams of growing her business. She has seen many people succeed as mobile money agents and wishes for the same success by opening more outlets as time goes by.

With the Kiva loan, she will be able to purchase a trading kiosk and have the funds needed to serve customers. Starting her own business will empower Beatrice financially and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a trading kiosk and have the funds needed to serve customers, so that she can start to operate her own business.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is now 75 years old but she is still working with the same enthusiasm She is still married.

Nina makes pillowcases to earn some money. She is retired, but her retirement fund is not enough for her.

She needs a loan to buy materials to make pillowcases that she will resell, as Christmas is coming she needs her own products and other because she wants to increase her sales

Although she is a senior citizen, she is healthy and strong. She hopes you can help her again. Ninfa is the only person that supports the home right now.

loans.use: to buy materials for making pillowcases.

loans.name: Lunsar Star Group

texts.en:
Mabinty is a 45-year-old businesswoman. She is a married with three children ages of 25, 19 and 15 years and all are school-going children. She is a member of “Lunsar Star” solidarity group. This group has five members. (see group picture, Mabinty is in the middle). Eleven years ago, Mabinty established her local foodstuff business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

“Lunsar Star” group needs a total loan of 6,000,000 SLL. Mabinty is entitled to 1,200,000 SLL, which she will use to buy bags of beans, dry pepper, local rice etc. to add to her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profits to support her family. In the future, Mabinty plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Mabinty and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, dry pepper, local rice, etc.

loans.name: Mallam Lawal

texts.en:
Mallam Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Mallam Lawal is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Mallam Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Mallam Lawal can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Mallam Lawal has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Mallam Lawal is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer from Tafki village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alhaji can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Alhaji hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sabitu

texts.en:
Sabitu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sabitu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sabitu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Sabitu can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Sabitu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Sabitu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Balkibai And Group

texts.en:
Balkibai is a mother of one child and lives with her family in the Badwani district of Madhya Pradesh. She runs a grocery store in her village. Her current monthly income amounts to Rs. 4000. She works hard to sustain her family. She believes that by buying more stock and expanding her grocery store, she will be able to earn better and lead a more comfortable life. She expects her monthly income to increase by Rs. 3000. But Balkibai does not have the required funds to expand her business. She thus seeks a loan. With the loan, she will buy stock of oil, grains, snacks, etc.

Balkibai leads a group of six women who have come together to apply for a loan to invest in their respective businesses. This group of women is grateful to its lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stock of oil, grains, etc. to expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Thongphankham Group

texts.en: Vin’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Vin and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Vin and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Vin’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Hadxiengtom Group

texts.en: Noy understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Noy knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Noy purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Noy is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Muhammad has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammad would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Muhammad can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Muhammad will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Muhammad is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Somsawad Group

texts.en: Vilone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Vilone and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Vilone and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Vilone’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro and his wife Ivonne own a local convenient store in El Seco in the Mexican state of Puebla. They have been living in their house for over 37 years. It first started as a single room and gradually it has grown to accommodate the family. However, the kitchen and the kids bedroom still has a dirt floor since a rooms and bathrooms were a priority during the last construction work. One of their kids has presented some respiratory illness and the doctor says having a clean house with the least amount of dust possible is essential.

To do so, they need to build a proper floor as soon as possible and that is why they are requesting this credit. They also want to finish off the walls so they can avoid the wind and water coming through the cracks.

Their store is an informal business and income is not guaranteed, so access credit from other institutions is very difficult. Pedro and Ivonne will receive technical assistance and supervision from certified technicians that will make sure the constructions meets all quality and safety standards. Pedro and Ivonne are looking forward to do this final improvements to their home and provide their family with a better health and a better life.

loans.use: to help his son overcome his respiratory illness by replacing the dirt floor and finish the walls of his house

loans.name: Amr

texts.en:
Amr is 28, single, lives with his parents and 3 siblings in the same house, and has a small clothing project.

He previously requested 2 consecutive loans from TADE and one from Kiva. He is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy modern clothing to expand his project and increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy kids clothing.

loans.name: Rajiya And Group

texts.en:
Rajiya hails from the Jhabua district in Madhya Pradesh. She lives there with her husband and four children. To sustain her family, she runs a ready-made-clothes selling business. Currently, she makes Rs. 3,000 every month. She believes that expanding her business will help her earn better for the family. She lacks the funds to invest in the expansion of her business. Thus, she seeks a loan. With the loan, she will purchase clothes like leggings, kurtis, etc. to sell in her village.

Rajiya leads a group of five women. Just like Rajiya, the other women need a loan to invest in their respective businesses. The loan will not only help them expand their businesses, but will also help them lead more comfortable lives.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothes like leggings, kurtis, etc. for her ready-made-clothes selling business.

loans.name: Gs Nuevos Horizontes Group

texts.es:
Luis  Es nativo de la aldea de San Isidro de Santa Cruz De Yojoa,  Vive con su esposa y sus hijos. El es una persona muy reconocida en la aldea ya que es muy amigable y colaborador con sus  vecinos.
Luis se dedica al cultivo de malanga cuenta con una amplia experiencia en la producción de este cultivo. El solicita el préstamo para asistir su cultivo de malanga con fertilizantes, abonos y riego ya que el espera obtener mejor ganancias porque sabe que cultivo bien asistido obtiene mejor producción.
Luis espera que con este préstamo pueda darle una buena asistida a su cultivo y así producir un producto de calidad.  El sueño que tiene Luis es tener bastantes manzanas de cultivo de malanga y así reparar su vivienda para darle una mejor vida para sus hijos.
Yessica  vive en la aldea de San Isidro. Nativa de dicho lugar vive junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo. Ella es una persona honrada trabajadora y responsable. Ella se dedica a la siembra de malanga en dicha aldea. 
José  Vive  en la aldea de San Isidro.  Junto a su esposa y su hijo.  El es un joven luchador, responsable y muy amigable. El se dedica a la producción de yuca, maíz y frijoles.
Todos ellos solicitan el préstamo para invertir en sus cultivos ya que necesitan capital para seguir generando ingresos a sus familias.


Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Cortes. Honduras- Octubre  del 2015
texts.en:
Luis is a native of the town of San Isidro of Santa Cruz De Yojoa. He lives with his wife and children. He is a well-known person in the town since he is very friendly and collaborates with his neighbors.

Luis works growing taro. He has a great deal of experience in the production of this crop. He is requesting the loan to help his taro crop with fertilizer, compost, and irrigation. He is hoping to bring in better profit, because he knows that a well-attended crop yields better production.

Luis hopes that with this loan he will be able to attend to his crop well, and thereby produce a high-quality product. His dream is to have many manzanas [a land unit about 1.736 acres] of taro crop and thereby to repair his home, in order to give his children a better quality of life.

Yessica lives in the town of San Isidro. She is a native of that place, and she lives with her two children and her husband. She is an honorable, hardworking, and responsible person. She works planting taro in that town.

José lives in the town of San Isidro, along with his wife and son. He is a determined, responsible, and very friendly young man. He works in the production of cassava, corn, and beans.

They are all requesting the loan to invest in their crops, since they need the capital to keep generating income for their families.

Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras, October 2015

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, and irrigation for his taro crop.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.en:
Alvaro is 19 years old. He is learning how to be a carpenter which is going very well.

Alvaro would like to start his own woodworks, so he needs a loan to buy wood. He works a lot and he has a positive outlook.

Alvaro is single. He doesn't have children, but he lives with his parents and he helps them a lot, so he hopes you can trust him. He would like to have his own business in the future

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
In spite of the obstacles that Virginia has encountered in her life, she still has the courage to go on and continue dreaming for her loved ones. Virginia is a mother of six children. Most of them have their own families, but she still needs to work hard for her school-aged children. Currently, she does a manicure and pedicure business to earn. She also raised pigs as well.
With this, she is requesting a loan buy assorted nail polish and cuticle remover. She will also buy feed for her pigs. In the future, Virginia is thinking of other business opportunities that will enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy assorted nail polish and cuticle remover; feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is 46 years old, married and has 10 year old son. 

Her husband works hard as a farmer while Virginia sells food (snacks) in the community just to earn a living and help her husband. She has been doing this for 12 years. 

Virginia is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as milled rice, coconut milk, and sugar. 

In the future, she wishes to become successful in her business and that they would have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as milled rice, coconut milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37 years old supporting 5 people in her family, she fried fish in her local market, a business she has been doing for the last 17 years and gets a monthly income of Kes 25000.


She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more fish to fry and sell.


She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is 36 years old, married with two children.

Robelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, snack foods, canned goods, etc.

Robelyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from E-Loading station.

Robelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo, snack foods, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Anam

texts.en:
Anam is 20 years old woman, and mother of 1 child and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession.

Anam's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore Anam has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 24 years old lady and a responsible mother of two children, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own construction business for past 12 years. Yasmeen's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise e.g cement, concrete and bricks etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these merchandises.

To fulfill the need of her husband Yasmeen has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy these merchandises for business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs
Yasmeen is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Nosheen is responsible mother of 2 children, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 3 years. Her husband needs to do maintenance of his taxi because the current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Nosheen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Nosheen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Nosheen also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Nosheen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Doña Marta de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, la clienta posee una tienda en su casa de habitación en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 30 años, su deseo es ampliar mas su tienda con el fin de mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos ya que desea dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: huevos, cereales, golosinas, aceite, macarrones, detergente, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Marta, age 61, lives in her own house with her family group.  For thirty years, this client has had a store in her house, in which she sells a variety of staple goods.  Her dream is to expand her store more, with the goal of improving sales and income, since she wants to give her family the best conditions of life.  For that reason, she is requesting this loan from Integral to buy products for her store such as eggs, grains, sweets, oil, macaroni, detergent, and thereby have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy eggs, grains, sweets, oil, macaroni, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Gs Camelias Group

texts.es:
El Señor Jael Isaias tiene 43 años de edad, es padre de un hijo, convive con su compañera de hogar, habita en la Aldea de San Antonio de Oriente, Su actividad principal es la caficultura, donde cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad y tambien se dedica a la agricultura de donde cuenta con ingresos.
Jael su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con el credito que esta solicitando podra obtener la planta solar un sueño que ha tenido desde hace tiempo el cual se hara realidad por que con una planta solar le cambiara la forma de vivir, y se le hara realidad tambien su sueño a su familia con  el apoyo de la  Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA.
Los demas integrantes se dedican a la caficultura y Agricultura lo integran: Sixto Antonio y Erik Samuel quienes tambien sueñan con tener luz en sus hogares para que sus familias tengan acceso a el desarrollo.




                                                             Trojes, Honduras - Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Jael Isaias, 43, is the father of a son and lives with his partner. He resides in the town of San Antonio de Oriente. He earns a living growing coffee, he is very experienced in the management of this activity, and he also works in agriculture for additional income.

Jael dreams of improving the living conditions for his family, and he is requesting this loan to get a solar power system that he has wanted for a long time. With the support of Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras and Kiva, his dream will become a reality, because solar power will change their way of life.

The other members in this group work in coffee growing and agriculture. They include Sixto Antonio and Erik Samuel, both of whom also dream of having electricity in their homes for their families by gaining access to this technology.

Trojes, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy an 80-watt solar power system for his home.

loans.name: Hanitriniaina Felamboahirana

texts.en:
Hanitriniaina is a hardworking woman of 25 years. She is still single. She still lives with her parents, but in a separate room and they are partially dependent.

She is a dealer, purchasing and reselling of spare parts in iron, sheet metal, used tires etc. as seen on the photo. She has continued to increase the stock of goods, which is a condition for developing her activity. Indeed, she is currently very passionate to develop the business.

Before, she only sold pots and used phones. The proposed articles have become increasingly diversified over time, and especially to meet the needs of her customers. She started and has maintained this for seven years. She wants to prepare for the future by building a savings and building a house.

loans.use: to buy scrap like dampers, segments, motors, and other parts already worn.

loans.name: Amistad Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Eufemia Judith tiene 53 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo "Amistad y progreso", grupo con poco tiempo de formado pero que hasta ahora han demostrado trabajo en equipo, compromiso y responsabilidad.
Eufemia Judith se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza solo los días sábados y domingos, ya que en el transcurso dela semana se dedica exclusivamente a la atención de su familia ya que tiene hijos menores de edad que aun requiere su atención.
Apesar de trabajar solo dos días por semana, no se puede quejar, le ha ido bien su negocio, ve su ganancia inmediatamente y puede disponer de ella para los gastos que necesite cubrir.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como arroz, tubérculos, vegetales, etc para la preparación de la comida que ofrecerá a la venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eufemia Judith is 53 years old. She is part of the "Amistad y Progreso" (Friendship and Progress) group. The group formed a short time ago, but has already demonstrated teamwork, compromise, and responsibility.

Eufemia Judith is dedicated to selling food, which is work she does by herself on Saturdays and Sundays. During the rest of the week, she is dedicated exclusively to taking care of her family, since she has young children who need her attention.

Despite working only on the weekends, she can't complain. Her business has been going well; she sees her earnings immediately and can use the earnings for the expenses she needs to cover.

The loan will be invested in buying supplies, such as corn, tubers, vegetables, etc. to make the food she will offer to sell.

loans.use: to invest in buying supplies to make food.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy con 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz.

Willy es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Willy is 27 years old and is in a relationship. He lives in his own house made of rustic material. He lives with his partner and their 6-year-old son in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca in Peru. He has many good personal and professional references from the people in the area. The residents of this area are mostly dedicated to agriculture, business, and livestock.

He is dedicated to agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 4 years of experience in this work. The loan that is offered will be used in agricultural work, allowing him to apply and incorporate pesticides and fertilizers and to pay workers for his harvest. This will help him improve the physiology, morphology, and productivity of his crop, so that he will have a timely harvest and, thus, a better production and better quality product, so that he won't have any problems in selling his product. He is also dedicated to growing corn.

Willy is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has a bank guarantee.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers and to pay workers for his harvest.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
María, de 44 años de edad, no logro estudiar, está casada, pero desde hace mucho tiempo su esposo decidió abandonarlos por razones no especificas, en su casa solo vive con su hijo que está estudiando en la universidad y una hermana que le ayuda con el negocio.

María, desde hace bastante tiempo se dedica a dos negocios que le permiten obtener ingresos permanentes para mantener a su familia, el primero es una venta de tortillas y en tiempos específicos o de fiestas vende comida rápida y su hijo y su hermana le ayuda.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, harina, papas, aceite, gas para cocina y mejorar su sistema de calentamiento y cocción de los alimentos.

María, sueña con sacar adelante a su hijo, ayudarle a que termine su carrera universitaria, y motivarlo a que busque una alternativa de trabajo que asegure su futuro.
texts.en:
