Maria is a 44 year old without formal education and married but her husband left her some time ago for unknown reasons. She lives at home with her son, who is studying at university, and a sister who helps with the business.

For quite some time Maria has earned living from two businesses which allows her to have a steady income to support her family. The first is the sale of tortillas and at specific times or festivals she sells fast food with help of her son and sister.

Maria needs a loan to buy corn, flour, potatoes, oil and gas for cooking and to improve her heating system and ability to cook food.

Maria dreams of providing for her son to help him to finish his college degree and motivate him to find alternative work that will ensure his future.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, potatoes, oil and gas for cooking and to improve her heating system and ability to cook food.

loans.name: Alh. Abdullahi

texts.en:
Alh. Abdullahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Abdullahi is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Alh. Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Abdullahi will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for hismaize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Alh. Abdullahi now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for hisself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en: Eulogio is 76 years old  he is a senior citizen and he gets a retirement payment every month. He is paying rent and he has a daughter. At this time he needs a loan to pay a knee medical intervention because his articulations are suffering despite that his condition is good.

loans.use: to pay a knee medical intervention

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, tiene 2 años de tener el negocio el cual inicio con ayuda de su familia, la joven vive en casa propia con sus padres, anteriormente ya habia solicitado un credito el cual le sirvio para comprar mas mercadeia, hoy esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas queso, crema, quesillo, entre otras cosas y poder continuar con sus ventas ya que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 23 years old and lives in a high risk zone earns a living through the sale of dairy products. She's had the business two years which she started with the help of her family. 

The young women lives in her own home with her parents. Previously she had requested a loan that enabled her to buy more merchandise. Today she is requesting again a loan to buy more cheese, cream, cottage cheese, among other things and be able to continue her sales that generate good profits.

loans.use: buy more cheese, cream, cottage cheese, among other things

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA.
El socio Franklin continúa dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de guía de turismo, el socio sigue haciendo diferentes tipos de tours como City Tours Valle Sagrado, Machupicchu entre otros, el socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, él socio es una persona responsable el cual espera poder continuar trabajando para así continuar apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ingresos para sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SEÑOR DE HUANCA communal bank.

Franklin continue dedicated himself to his career as a tour guide. He continues offering different types of tours, such as City Tours, Valle Sagrado, and Machupicchu, among others. He is thankful to those that are part of this dream through the loans, and he promises to repay the loan according to the established schedule. He is a responsible person who hopes to be able to continue working to continue supporting his family.

He requests the loan to buy tickets for his passengers.

loans.use: to buy tickets for his passengers.

loans.name: Clara Estela

texts.es: Clara de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solevntar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Clara is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her three children. She has had a small store for 3 years located in her home. She sells a variety of products, such as sweets, drinks, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc., and she has many clients because of her good prices. With what she earns from her sales, she succeeds in paying for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale. Since this is her only source of income, the loan will allow her to have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Houwaida

texts.en: Houwaida is a 35-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three school aged children. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time, as per her husband, he is the main income provider in the family and working so hard to help his beloved family to live in good conditions. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s school educational fees, what makes her very joyful.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school educational fees.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia con 55 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de la crianza y venta de animales como patos,gallinas y cuyes, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento para sus animales. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Otilia a tenido un préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa de S/.1,000.00 el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Otilia is 55 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives in her own home with her partner and son in the district of Cayaltí in the province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Peru . She has very good personal and employment references from residents of the area. The people of this town mostly make their living in agriculture, sales, and livestock trade.

Otilia is makes a living raising and selling animals such as ducks, chickens and guinea pigs, with over 10 years of experience, which she runs our of her own home. She is requesting a loan to buy food for her animals. Through this loan she will grow her business, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

Otilia previously had a S / 1,000.00 loan with Edpyme Alternative S which was repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is 61 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She is in a retail business, selling goods to her local community members. She is already 30 years in the business and earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000.00. She wants to expand her business in order to support the needs of her children in paying school fees and other household bills. She is asking for a financial assistance, and recently, she took a loan to buy more grocery goods to boost her inventory stock and to have a greater income. Claudia's plan for the future is to save more money to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods for the business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander con 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de San Felipe,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de soldadura,cuenta con un pequeño taller de carpintería metálica, con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica al comercio y venta de combustible. Solicita préstamo para la realizar arreglos en su taller mecánico. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

Alexander es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Este es su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Alexander, age 31, is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife and son in the district of San Felipe, in the province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good personal and professional references from the denizens of the zone. The majority of the residents of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising.

He works offering welding services. He has a small metalwork workshop and more than five years of experience in this line of work. He also works in commerce and fuel sales. He is requesting the loan to make some repairs in his mechanical workshop. In this way, he will be able to have acceptable profit in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Alexander is a recurring borrower of Edpyme Alternativa. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to make repairs in his mechanical workshop.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annabelle is 39 years old and has one child currently in school. Annabelle has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

Annabelle requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell. Annabelle has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman, 49 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gina has a weaving business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials such as, abacca, silk and other materials for her business.

Gina has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as, abacca, silk and other materials for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own  that  neither has electricity nor  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is married. He operates a boutique of new clothes, bags, and shoes for now three years. He used his personal savings to start off his current business. He desires to have a bigger shop, and hopes to get there.

Being the Christmas season, Jackson would love to buy more new clothes hoping for higher sales, but he is limited by capital and high transport costs to the shopping centre. He is requesting for money to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 32 years old. She lives with her 2 daughters in Senaki district. Nana is unemployed now and the family lives in poverty. She decided to start trade clothes and generate income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 400 USD. With the received credit she will purchase clothes to resell at higher price. This will give her a chance to generate stable income and feed her children. Nana is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade in clothes.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 56 years old lady, married and a mother of 5 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 to benefit from savings, enterprise and financial management training.

She does mixed farming and she has applied for a Kiva loan to boost her agribusiness by buying farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. This will help her produce more grains and cereals to satisfy meet her customer’s demands hence improving her living standards and pay education fees for her children.
She is happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer and get more produce and income to improve her living standards and pay education fees for her children.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es: Marizol es conviviente con hijos dependientes. Ella es poseedora de una bodega que implemento en su vivienda hace varios años. Ella expende productos de toda variedad abarrotes bebidas  útiles de limpieza útiles de aseo personal productos de belleza y útiles de escritorio. De esa manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de educación y alimentación de sus hijos.  El crédito que obtuvo lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes útiles de limpieza aseo personal y útiles  de escritorio.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Marizol se encuentra parada viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
Marital is in a relationship and has dependent children. She has had a store in her home for many years. She sells all types of products, including groceries, drinks, cleaning supplies, personal products, beauty products, and office supplies. In this way, she is able to support her husband with the education and food expenses for their children.

The loan will be invest in buying more groceries, cleaning supplies, personal products, and office supplies.

The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Marital is standing in the black sweater in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, school supplies, and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Gs Emprendedores De Poncaya Group

texts.es:
La Señora Betty tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, habita en la colonia Poncaya Olancho, al Oriente de Honduras, es Casada, Su actividad principal es la Agricultura la cual le genera ingresos a diarios atravez de su productividad, lo cual le permite cubrir sus gastos familiares y financieros obtenidos.
Doña Betty su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y la de su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños ya que podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes, abonos y vitaminas para su cultivo de yuca.
Su grupo lo integran: Basilia tiene 2 hijos y convive con su esposo y se dedica a la agricultura ,Belkin es comerciante de productos para bellesa, y tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, Keyla es madre soltera tiene un hijo y se dedica a criar y engordar cerdos,  y Aminadac el habita en poncaya Olancho y su fuente principal es el comercio de cerdos, y convive con su esposa y sus hijos.
El Grupo Emprendedores de Poncaya solicitan el apoyo y asi mismo lograr sus sueños.


Trojes Honduras - Noviembre 2015.
texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old, has three children, and lives in Poncaya Olancho in eastern Honduras. She is married and her main business is in agriculture, which generates income daily due to her productivity, which allows her support her family and their financial expenses.

Betty's dream is to improve her and her family's living conditions; the loan will help her achieve her goals because she will be able to buy goods such as fertilizers, manure, and vitamins for growing yuca.

Her group consists of: Basilia who has 2 children and lives with her husband and works in agriculture, Belkin who sells beauty products and has 2 children who are in school, Keyla who is a single mother to one son and makes a living raising and fattening pigs, and Aminadec who lives in Poncaya Olancho, mainly sells pigs, and lives with his wife and children.

The group "Emprendedores de Poncaya" is requesting the support to be able to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and vitamins for her yuca crop.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 32 years old and has four children who are in school.

Nenita has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribel is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maribel has a buy and sell beverages business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of beverages to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of beverages to sell.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: Lucila tiene 57 años de edad es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a través de catalogo hace varios años. Y a la vez presta servicios de cocinera de manera genera su ingreso económico. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos perfumes cremas esmaltes labiales que estén en oferta para poderlos expender a un precio que le generen buenas ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Lucila es la tercera del lado derecho viste chaleco azul y pantalón beige.
texts.en:
Lucila is 57 years old and is single with independent children. She makes a living selling cosmetics via catalog, which she has done for several years. She also offers cooking services which allows her to generate more income.

Lucila is requesting a loan to purchase products such as perfume, cream, and lipstick which are on sale so that she can sell them at a price that will generate good profits. The group thanks the investors for their support through the Kiva loan. Lucila is the third person from the right wearing a blue jacket and beige pants.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Lelet

texts.en:
Lelet is 40 years old and has four children. Lelet is married and has four children who are in school.

Lelet is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lelet requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Lelet has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lelet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
CARMEN JUANA, tiene 53 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "San Miguel Arcangel" formado por cinco socios.
carmen Juana se dedica desde hace 5 años a la administración y atención de su propio negocio del giro de librería bazar, ubicado en un centro comercial de mucha concurrencia, por lo que en las ventas le ha ido muy bien, logrando asi una estabilidad económica, luego de mucho trabajo y sacrificio.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de artículos de regalo y juguetes para ofrecer en ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
53-year-old CARMEN JUANA, is a member of the "San Miguel Arcangel" group, which has five members.

Carmen Juana has been running her own book stall and bazaar for five years. She sells her goods in a very busy shopping centre and so her business is doing well. This means that she is financially stable, thanks to her hard work and sacrifice.

She will use the loan to buy gifts and toys to offer to her customers during the Christmas period.

loans.use: to buy gifts

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 51-year-old married woman and has no dependents. More than 5 years ago she started working in the field to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their household.

Rosalina grows rice and corn. Aside from farming, she also sells firewood to her neighbors and the nearby residents. She is trying to develop both of her businesses, but it seems that farming is in need of more capital in order to gain higher yields.

Rosalina has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and pesticides. These are very essential tools that could help her produce a bountiful harvest.

In this way, Rosalina would be able to both pay her obligations and seek ways to become more efficient. She is hoping that, someday, she will become productive in both her livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 41 years old and married with three children.

Nida is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora de 62 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de pupusas, en las noches, ya que durante el día vende almuerzos y en los fines de semana prepara panes rellenos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Ella es una mujer admirable que vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace muchos años, por lo que es muy reconocida en su comunidad. María desea agrandar y mejorar su negocio, para ofrecer un mejor servicio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en materia prima para preparar su venta de comida, pupusas y panes rellenos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 62, is a hard-working woman who makes a living selling pupusas at night, lunches during the day, and on weekends she makes stuffed breads which are highly requested by her clients.

She is an admirable woman who has lived in her own house for many years, and she is very well known in her community.

María wants to expand and improve her business so that she can offer better service. She is seeking a loan through FUSAI to invest in raw materials for preparing pupusas and stuffed breads to sell, and improve her business.

loans.use: invest in raw materials to prepare pupusas and stuffed breads to sell, and improve her business.

loans.name: Gs Sendas De Amor Group

texts.es:
La Señora Iris Wuvaldina Habita en este municipio de trojes tiene 51 años de edad  convive con su compañero de hogar , su actividad es el comercio contando con una venta de ropa nueva y joyas el cual con mucha dedicación sale a realizar sus ventas de manera ambulante y esto le ha permitido ir creciendo cada días más en su negocio y en su familia.
Iris el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de camisas, pantalones, suéteres, faldas, blusas, pulseras, cadenas, relojes, anillos y otros artículos para la venta.
Iris está muy agradecida con Prisma y KIVA por el apoyo brindado ya que con los créditos que se le han otorgado los ha invertido muy bien y cada día mejora mas su estilo de vida ya que su sueño es poder tener un buen negocio grande y emplear personas  sin empleos.
Iris integra el grupo con su pariente que se dedica al comercio y es Silvia María

                                                                             Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre 2015
texts.en:
Iris Wuvaldina lives in the town of Trojes. She is 51 years old and lives with her common law partner. Her occupation is commerce -- she sells clothing and jewelry on the street. Her dedication has allowed her to grow her business.

Iris is requesting a loan to buy shirts, pants, sweaters, skirts, blouses, bracelets, necklaces, watches, rings and other items for sale. 

Iris is very thankful with Prisma and Kiva for the support they have provided, as the loans that she has received have allowed her to improve her lifestyle. Her dream is to have a large business and employ people who do not currently have jobs. 

Iris is part of the Sendas de Amor group, which focuses on commerce. The other member is Silvia Maria.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, sweaters, skirts, blouses, bracelets, necklaces, watches, rings and other items for sale.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA.
La socia sigue  dedicándose  a sus  negocios  de venta de chicha, cerveza y  pollipapas, la socia es una mujer responsable, la socia espera poder continuar con sus negocios ya que mediante sus negocios la socia puede apoyar a su familia, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a sus negocios los cuales le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia espera agrandar sus negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cerveza ,maíz entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Señor de Huanca” communal bank.

The borrower continues working in her business selling chicha [a beverage made from corn], beer, and pollipapas [a dish consisting of chicken and fried potatoes]. She is a responsible woman. She hopes to continue with her business, since through her business she is able to support her family. She has been working in her business for years, and it brings her personal satisfaction. She hopes to expand her business, since this is the way she supports her family.

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy corn and beer, among other things.

The borrower thanks those who are taking part in her dream through these means, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer and corn, among other things.

loans.name: Rosa Lastenia

texts.es:
Rosa Lastenia con 51 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de lo moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica al alquiler de cabinas de internet y videojuegos, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 02 años. Adiconalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral. Solicita préstamo para la compra de material para la construcción de su techo de su vivienda y otros gastos personales. De esta manera obtendrá mayor y mejor atención para sus clientes y así poder generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

Rosa Lastenia es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
51-year-old Rosa Lastenia is married and lives with her husband in their own home. They live in the district of Cayaltí, in Chiclayo province, which is in Lambayeque department in Peru. She gets very good references (personal and work-related) from local residents. Most of the region's inhabitants work in agriculture, trade and livestock farming.

Her work involves hiring out internet and videogame booths, and she has more than 2 years' experience. She also rears and sells farmyard animals . She is applying for a loan to buy the materials to build a roof on her home and to cover other personal expenses. This will enable her to serve her customers better and, as a result, generate more income so she can provide a better quality of life for herself and her family.
Rosa Lastenia is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.



Rosa Lastenia es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to build a roof for her home and o cover other personal expenses

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 51-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, rice, meat, spices, etc.

Lorna has been in this business for 2 years. Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, rice, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Kenneth

texts.en:
Ma. Kenneth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Kenneth is 25 years old and has one child currently in school.

Ma. Kenneth has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like lotion, roll on, face powder, etc..

She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ma. Kenneth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, roll on, face powder, etc.

loans.name: Ledemor

texts.en:
Ledemor works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ledemor has been in this business for 9 years now.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy a larger variety of fish to sell.

Ledemor would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Carol has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from selling spare parts.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Theresa is 28 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Theresa has a buy and sell herbal products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy herbal products, such as capsule, coffee, etc.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy herbal products, such as capsule, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 63 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

Mercedes has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mercedes aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them. She has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, diapers, milk, cereals, canned goods, detergent soap, etc.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like sanitary pads, diapers, milk, cereals, canned goods, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like sanitary pads, diapers, milk, cereals, canned goods, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell spare parts business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ana is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of spare parts to sell to her customers.

Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spare parts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No is a married mother of 3 children. At 31 years old, she is a very hardworking woman. She has her own fishing business.

No has requested a loan in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, No would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a widowed mother of 6 children, 5 of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Over the past 5 years, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her business.

With the 20,000 KES loan that she is requesting, Lela wants to purchase bales of clothing to resell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Khanh is 41 years old, and she is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children, two of them are schooling.

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family as well as protecting the environment.

Husbandry and fishing are the main income sources of her family, so she is able to pay back the loan monthly from chicken raising activity and selling fish that her husband catches.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin con 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a cliente a su cónyuge y su hijo de 10 años de edad, el cuál cursa primaria en colegio nacional, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, ubicado en el Caserio Yambolon - Pomahauca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz.

Fermin es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Fermin is 29, in a common law marriage and lives in his own house with his partner and 10-year-old son. His son attends primary school in the district of Pomahuaca in the province of Jaen in the department of Cajamarca in Peru. He has as many very good personal references as work ones from the people in the area. The people in the town mostly earn a living from agriculture and the livestock trade.

He earns a living from agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee, and is based in the hamlet of Yambolon, Pomahauca where he has four years experience in the industry. The loan granted will be used for farming work and the application and incorporation of pesticides and fertilizers as well as labour for harvesting.

This will help to improve the physiology, morphology and productivity of his farming. This way he'll have a timely harvest and therefore higher production with a better product quality which means he will have no problems in selling his products. He also earns a living from the cultivation of corn.

Fermin is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in farming work, the application and incorporation of pesticides and fertilizers as well as labour for harvesting.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 24 years old and married with two children who are currently in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Edna has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, such as candies, biscuits, noodles, soft-drinks, beers, cereals, coffee, etc.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 30 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, candies, coffee, detergent soap, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, candies, coffee, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 51 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines.

Bernadeth is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her chickens. She has been raising chickens for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.en:
Olimpia is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as detergents, milks, sardines, candles, biscuits, aqua, cooking oils, sugar, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

Olimpia started her kiosk business a few years ago, with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan that she was offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And she will increase her income with this loan.

loans.use: to buy detergents, milks, sardines, candles, biscuits, aqua, cooking oils, sugar, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong is a hardworking woman, 46 years old. She lives with her husband and four children in a small house, without a hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing.

She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has been involved in business activities since a few years ago, when she started with her own working capital of $1,500. Now Carmelita is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business.

She has a kiosk in her house, and she earns a good income from her business because she lives near many people. She is still happy to do her business.

When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she felt very happy because she can be improving her business. She is taking this loan to buy more items according to what the people like, such as cooking oils, eggs, detergents, sardines, coffee, tea, milk, noodles, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, eggs, detergents, sardines, coffee, tea, milk, noodles, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien is a hardworking woman, 29 years old. She is married and has two children. Her income is mainly from husbandry and fishing.

With support from her husband, her income is able to repay the loan monthly as requested. She is interested in improving the living standard for her family, and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es: Ana de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 37 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and their three daughters. She has worked for several years selling products for personal use. Her business is located in her place of residence and she is also a street vendor in the different villages. 

She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale perfume, lotion, cream, shampoo, deodorant, etc. Then, she will be able to continue working and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy wholesale perfume, lotion, cream, shampoo, deodorant, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 29-year-old tailor at Kilifi, Kenya. She is a single lady who has been in this business for the last three years, with a good income.

This is her first time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase African prints and sewing thread for making scatter cushions.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan and expand her business.

She hopes to supply major hotels in the coastal region with her products.

loans.use: to purchase African prints and sewing thread for making scatter cushions.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Butuan City, Philippines. She is 60 years old already and has 5 children who are working and helping with the household expenses. She is a widow and she manages a fruit stand business on her own to provide for their everyday needs.

Petronila buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, such as pineapple, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells watermelon, papaya, native apples, and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Petronila is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell. She will use both her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

In the future, Petronila hopes to find new customers and increase sales. She also dreams that her only granddaughter will be able to finish her studies. Petronila meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fruit she sells such as pineapple, papaya, native apple, watermelon, and other Filipino fruit staples.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Melanie is 18 years old and is 1st of three children in the family. Her mother Estela supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.


Melanie is studying Bachelor of Arts in Developmental Communication and is currently in the 2nd of this 4 years-year course.

Estela is borrowing 4249 to pay tuition fees of the second semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Melanie plans to to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees in Developmental Communication.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 46 years old and married with twelve children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Melodina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for 13 years. She earns additional income from vegetable vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luzvizminda

texts.en:
Luzvizminda is 56 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Luzvizminda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Luzvizminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has piped water and electricity. She cites food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past 15 years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating of hairdressing skills in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Lwempwanyi Fullgospel Church Group

texts.en:
The members belong to Lwepwanyi Fullgospel church,Yesu kabaka- a faith based group in rural Lyantonde-western Uganda.

Lydia, 53 is a hardworking woman who earns a living in her business of selling produce such as tubers, vegetables and fruits. She wants to get ahead making this effort for her household.

She requested for the loan to buy bananas and mangoes.

The other members earn a living in animal sales, clothing sales, grocery sales, and food sales. They're grateful for the loan granted by Kiva lenders and they promise to make their repayments timely.

loans.use: to buy bananas and mangoes for selling.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 30-year-old woman who resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home.

Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. With these, he will be able to generate more income for financially supporting his family.

Saima is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for her husband's shuttering work.

loans.name: Bernadete

texts.en:
A $ 1000.00 is offered to Bernadate to improve her business. she has a second hand clothing business where many people come to buy every day. She will buy shirts, pants, long sleeves, short sleeves.She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Bernadete independent because she can be responsible for herself and it also helps her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, long sleeves, short sleeves.

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh is a hardworking woman, 58 years old. She lives with her husband.

She needs a loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve the health of her family members and also for environmental protection.

Her family’s income is from husbandry and a salary, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 43-year-old lady, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 and has benefited from all the training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

She does maize, beans and potato farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to expand her mixed farming by buying certified seeds. This will enable her to increase her production and have more income to support basic family needs such as food and shelter, and pay education fees for her children.

Susan is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this help and support; she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to  buy certified seeds, hence more produce and income to meet her family's basic needs such as food and shelter, and pay education fees for her children.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Mr. Hung is 50 years old. He is a single man. He would like to improve his living standard but lacks capital. The loan can help him to build a sanitation latrine to improve his health. He is able to repay the loan from husbandry and hired labor.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve his standard of living and his health.

loans.name: Dien

texts.en:
Mrs. Dien is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and four children. She runs the business selling groceries and goods to her villagers.

As the source of income for her family, she sells everyday necessities like oil, sugar, wheat flour, salt, biscuits, etc. She is keen on growing her business with the infusion of a little loan capital. This will help her to purchase additional quantities of items she already stocks.

The loan amount will be helpful because she has little savings to reinvest in her business at present, and she cannot purchase items on credit from the wholesalers.

She is requesting a loan to buy a stock of grocery items for the store in order to meet all the demand from her customers. The loan will help her business to grow and fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to stock grocery items for the store.

loans.name: Twone Mbee Mutitu Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Winfred, a member of Twone Mbee Mutitu Group. She is thirty-two years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management trainings.

She does maize, beans, and poultry farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides. This will greatly boost her business, and hence increase her income, which will enable her to cater for her children’s clothing, food, and other needs of the family.

Winfred is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides, and hence have more income to cater for her children's clothing, food, and other family expenses.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Musa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Musa can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Musa has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.
Musa is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kusumben And Group

texts.en:
33-year-old Kusumben is a widow hailing from Dahod district of Gujarat. She is blessed with three children two sons and a daughter all of them are attending local school in different grades. Besides being a housewife she also provides sewing services. She is the sole earner in the family. Therefore she works diligently to earn for her family. She runs a sewing business. Currently she earns Rs. 8000 every month. She is worried that her current rate of earning would not help her sustain her family in the long run.

She thus wants to expand her business and increase her monthly earning. She will use the loan amount to purchase new sewing machine. Kusumben leads a group of 3 women – Kusumben, Malatiben and Geetaben. Together they need a group loan to expand their respective businesses. They are grateful to their lenders for the financial support and encouragement.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Bolodignogoma Group

texts.fr:
Alima est commerçante des habits, âgé de 41 ans, habite au Mali, marié et mère  de 3 enfants âgé de 16 à22 ans. Elle est celle qui tient les pagnes en  main  sur photo, son mari  est cultivateur.
Elle exerce ce métier il y a 10 ans de cela, elle s’approvisionne et vend ses habits aux  marchés de sa localité et ses villages.
Elle a toujours bien remboursé ses emprunts  contractés auprès du RMCR très courageuse elle  sollicite un prêt pour accroitre ses activités de commerce d’habits, le prêt servira à  subvenir aux charges familiale. 
IL rêve d’être une grande commerçante dans la zone pour être utile pour sa communauté.
texts.en:
Alima is a clothing merchant. She lives in Mali and is a 41-year-old married mother of three children whose ages range from 16 to 22 years. She is the one holding the pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) in the photo. Her husband is a crop farmer.

She began this business 10 years ago. She buys and sells clothes at local markets and surrounding villages.

She has always repaid the loans granted from RMCR. She is courageously requesting a loan to expand her clothes trading activity, which will help her meet family expenditures.

She dreams of becoming a great local merchant so she can be useful to her community.

loans.use: sell clothing for profit

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, hermana, sobrina y sus dos hijas, ella posee desde hace 7 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 40 years old, lives in her own home with her mother, sister, niece and her two daughters. She has had a small store in her place of residence for 7 years. She has many customers because of good prices and her friendliness while selling. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc and to in that way have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Hajira

texts.en:
Hajira is 22 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, Hajira has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall business, which deals in fresh vegetables like tomatoes, greens and carrots.

To help expand her business, Hajira has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to manage her stock and add more fresh vegetables to increase her sales. It will thus help Hajira generate greater profits so that she can take care of her grandmother, who is very sick.

Hajira hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house of her own.

Hajira is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to manage her stock and add more fresh vegetables to increase her sales.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Analyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to both buy spare parts and gasoline and pay for tricycle maintenance.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to both buy spare parts and gasoline and pay for tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental  house that has electricity but no  piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen is 51 years old and married. Her husband works in fishing. She is taking out the loan so her husband can have the necessary resources to do his great work.

He and another person go out to high sea in their small boat to do their fishing work. They fish alongside a fishing boat, to which they give their catch of fish during the days they are at sea.

Sometimes, he goes out and doesn’t return for 15 days, which worries her since there are many dangers on the high seas. But he has to do it for the good of his family.

This loan will be used to buy nets, fishing line, fuel and food for the days they are out at sea. Her dream is to have a large boat for her husband to do his fishing work.

loans.use: to buy nets, fishing line, fuel and food for the days they are out at sea.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 42 years old and is married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store and has requested a loan through Quang Binh Women Development Fund to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Phuong has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Issa Gerardina

texts.es: Issa de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 9 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Issa is 36 years old, she lives in her own house with her two children and she has been engaging in preparing and selling pupusas for 9 years. Her activity is located close to where she lives, a very busy area. Thank to the income she earns with her sales she succeeds in paying for some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy pork cracklings, quesillo, beans and corn and other ingredients, in order to keep on carrying out her job that gives her a good income.

loans.use: buy buy pork cracklings, quesillo, beans and corn.

loans.name: Nema 2 Junior-Ps Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré en mai deux mille sept. Ce groupe est composé de femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce. Madame Jeanne Monique, qui est sur la photo, levant la main, est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de quarante et un ans et mère d'une fille et d'un garçon. Elle est dans la vente de légumes depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle compte, avec le montant sollicité, acheter une quantité important de paniers de légumes qu'elle va revendre. Les bénéfices vont servir à assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" loan association was inaugurated in May 2007. This group consists of women who are retail merchants.

Mrs. Jeanne Monique, who is holding up her hand in the photo, is the group's representative. She is a 41-year-old widowed mother of a daughter and a son. She has been selling vegetables for over five years.

She intends to use the amount requested to buy a large amount of baskets of vegetables she will then resell. Profits will be used to ensure her children's education and take care of the family.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Alhaji Muhammadu

texts.en:
Alhaji Muhammadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Muhammadu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Alhaji Muhammadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Muhammadu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Alhaji Muhammadu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married mother of 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old, and all 3 of her children are in school.

Virginia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Suleiman can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Suleiman has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Suleiman is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or to move into a bigger home. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gs El Viajo Group

texts.es:
El Señor Edilberto Tiene 47 años de edad, convive con su compañera de hogar  y sus cuatro hijos, tiene casa Propia, habita en la Comunidad de Cerro del Vijao, Trojes, El Paraíso, al Oriente de Honduras, Su actividad principal es Agricultura, actividad con la que cuenta con muchos años de experiencia, el se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijoles y en esta temporada de siembra cuenta con 1.5 manzanas cultivadas de frijoles de la cual espera obtener una produccion de 12 sacos por manzan; de esta actividad el obtiene sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares y compromisos financieros obtenidos.
Don Edilberto con el credito que nos ha solicitado el tiene como proyecto la limpia y fertilizacion de su cultivo de frijoles;  su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia.
Su grupo lo integran Frangel  y Olman Daniel quienes se dedican a la Agricultura, en la imagen podrán observar que sus tierras son productivas y con un buen clima para el cultivo, ademas de el bonito paisaje de su zona.

Trojes, Honduras, Octubre 2015.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 47 years old. He lives with his live-in partner and and their four children. He has his own home. He lives in the community of Cerro del Vijao, Trojes, El Paraíso, in the west of Honduras. His primary occupation is agriculture, an occupation that he has many years of experience in. He makes his living by growing corn and beans, and in this seeding season he has 1.5 "manzanas" (a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters) cultivated with beans, of which he hopes to obtain a yield of 12 bags per "manzana". Through this activity he obtains income to cover the family's expenses and financial obligations.

With the loan that he has requested from us, Edilberto is planning a project to clean and fertilize his bean crops. His dream is to be able to improve the living conditions of himself and his family. His group is made up of Frangel and Olman Daniel, who make their living in agriculture. In the image you can see that their lands are productive and have a good climate for harvesting, in addition to the beautiful scenery of their area.

Trojes, Honduras, October 2015.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides for his crops.

loans.name: Hilda Maribel

texts.es:
Hilda, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya tienen su propio hogar y su otra muchacha vive en casa con ella.

Hilda, vende productos de belleza por catalogo tales como lociones, cremas, maquillajes, sombras y todo lo relacionado a cosmetología; antes ella se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar, pero luego decidió buscar una fuente de ingresos que le ayudara a cubrir todas sus necesidades en su hogar.

Hilda, necesita el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar ropa para damas, caballero y niños, para que cuando salga a vender pueda ofrecerle otro producto más al cliente.

El sueño de Hilda, es que su negocio funcione y crezca para poder darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hilda, 56, studied until the 5th grade. She is a single mother of three children, two of whom already are grown and have their own homes; her youngest daughter still lives at home with her. Hilda sells beauty products from a catalog like lotions, creams, makeup, eye shadow and other cosmetics. Previously she was a housewife, but decided to look for a source of income to help cover the costs of her home.

Hilda needs a loan to grow her business and buy clothing for men, women and children so that when she goes out on sales calls she can offer her customers another product. Hilda's dream is for her business to work and to grow so that she can give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to grow her business and buy clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 45 years old and married and has two children; one child is still in school.

Anita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Anita has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 29 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Charlyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gnetaton Group

texts.fr:
Minata fait du stockage âgé de 32 ans elle habite au Mali, marié et mère de 6 enfants âgés de 2ans à 16 ans dont 2 scolarisés. Elle est celle qui a la main sur la tasse sur la photo, son mari est un cultivateur.
Très sérieuse dans son travail elle exerce le stockage il y a 6 ans de cela, elle tient toujours  ses engagement de remboursement avec le RMCR, s’approvisionne et vend ses produits aux marchés de sa localité et village voisin et gagne approximativement 10 000 FCFA de bénéfice mensuel.
Elle  sollicite  au près du RMCR un prêt  pour faire le stockage de fonio  et revends au moment opportun ses produits  pour tirer profit de cela et subvenir aux charges familiale grâce au revenus générer par cette activité.
texts.en:
Minata stores [cereal]. She lives in Mali and is a 32-year-old married mother of six children whose ages range from 2 to 16 years, two of whom attend school. She is the one holding a cup in the photo. Her husband is a crop farmer.

Very serious in her work she has been storing [grain] for the past six years. She has always kept her commitments in reimbursing RMCR. She buys and sells her products at local markets and nearby villages, and makes monthly profits of about 10,000 CFA francs.

She is requesting a loan from RMCR to store fonio (a variety of millet) to be resold at the right time to maximise profits, and use the income generated by this activity to meet family expenses.

loans.use: stock up on fonio (a variety of millet) for retail sales after eight months' storage.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es una mujer trabajadora de 77 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de diversos productos en un área de su vivienda, que ha designado para ello, por lo que se siente muy satisfecha de contar con este ingreso económico. Ella vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace 52 años, y es muy conocida en su comunidad. Emilia desea mejorar su negocio, porque en época navideñas las ventas aumentan, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ropa de dama y niño, arreglos, productos plásticos, entre otros productos para su negocio.
texts.en: Emilia is a hardworking woman aged 77 who engages in selling different products in an area of her house she has set up to carry out this activity. She is therefore satisfied with being able to count on this economic support. She owns her house, and she has been living there for 52 years, and she is well-known in her community. Emilia wants to improve her activity, as sales increase during Christmas; for this reason she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy women's clothes, children's clothes, accessories, plastic products and other items for her shop.

loans.use: buy women's clothes, children's clothes, accessories and plastic products.

loans.name: Señor De La Misericordia De Surco Group

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 35 años de edad es soltera con dos hijos dependientes.  Ella  se dedica a la venta de  gaseosas agua hace más de 5 años. Ella aprendió dicho negocio porque trabajaba como ayudante de ventas. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas gaseosas agua al por mayor y de esa manera podrá  ganar un poco más. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jacqueline es la quinta persona del lado izquierdo viste polo azul y chompa negra.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 35, is single with two dependent children. She has made a living selling soda water for more than five years. She learned this business because she worked as a sales assistant.

She will use the loan to buy more soda water at wholesale, and this way she will be able to earn a little more.

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the provided loan. Jacqueline is the fifth person from the left wearing a blue shirt and black sweater.

loans.use: buy more soda water.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a 40-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and maintenance for her business.

Criselda has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Filonila

texts.es:
Filonila, de 66 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está divorciada, es comerciante en pequeño, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres están casados y viven aparte, su otra hija vive en la casa con ella y es quien le ayuda a administrar el negocio y económicamente de ella solo depende una hija. 

Filonila, es dueña de una tienda desde hace 24 años, este negocio decidió colocarlo porque en el lugar donde vive eran pocas las tiendas que habían y le era muy rentable, aparte de eso ella tiene una tortillería en otro barrio de su pueblo y es una sobrina de ella quien elabora las tortillas.

Filonila, necesita el préstamo para ampliar más la tienda y colocar otros dos puestos de tortillas en su pueblo.

Filonila, sueña con que sus nuevos locales le funcionen y sean rentables, también desea seguir ayudando a su hija para que termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Filonila is 66 years old and studied through the sixth grade. She's a divorced small businesswoman with four children, of whom three are married and live separately from her. The fourth child, a daughter, is the only child who still depends on Filonila economically. She lives at home with Filonila and helps her run her business.
.
Filonila has owned a store for 24 years. She decided to open the business because there were few stores in the area where she lives. It's been very profitable, and she also owns a tortilla stall in another neighborhood of her village where her niece makes the tortillas.

Filonila needs the loan to expand her store more and open two more tortilla stalls in her village.

Filonila dreams that her two new locations will work out for her and be profitable; she also wants to continue helping her daughter so that her daughter can finish her studies.

loans.use: to expand her store and open two more tortilla stalls in her village.

loans.name: Niéta Ton Group

texts.fr: Femme courageuse travailleuse Salimata est celle qui est assise devant le haricot en main sur la photo du groupe ; Malienne âgée de 59 ans, mariée mère de 2 enfants âgé de 15 à 25 ans dont une fille scolarisé.
