Elle fait le commerce de haricot depuis plusieurs année et a toujours bien rembourser  les prêts contractés auprès de l’institution ; Salimata peut gagner 12500f par mois comme bénéfice, elle a besoin de prêt auprès du RMCR pour acheter plus de haricot et vendre plus pour augmenter ses revenus; elle rêve d’acheter les bœufs de labour pour la famille  et financer les  études de sa fille.
texts.en:
Salimata is a courageous, hard-working woman. She is the one sitting in front holding beans in the group photo. She is a 59-year-old Malian, and the married mother of two children aged 15 and 25 years, and whose daughter attends school.

She has been trading beans for several years and has always repaid loans from the institution. Salimata can make profits of 12,500 francs per month.

She is requesting a loan from RMCR to buy and sell more beans so as to increase her income. She dreams of buying oxen for the family and finance her daughter's education..

loans.use: trade beans to generate much profit

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, su pareja realiza los trabajos de su hogar, es padre de dos pequeños hijos que aun no estudian y vive con su pareja, sus hijos y sus padres.

Domingo, tiene 15 años de experiencia trabajando como agricultor, aprendió este oficio porque sus padres desde pequeño lo llevaban a las parcelas donde trabajaban y fue así como aprendió y ahora es una actividad que hace dignamente para llevar el sustento a su familia; el lugar donde trabaja está a 20 minutos de su casa y trabaja de 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 12:00 del medio día.- A parte de eso también tiene una pequeña crianza de pollos de engorde.

Domingo, necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrados para alimentar los pollos y comprar malla para encerrarlos.

Domingo, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y que la pequeña granja de pollos que tiene crezca.
texts.en:
Domingo, 34, studied until 6th grade. He is married and his wife takes care of their home. They have two young children who are not yet in school, and he and his family live with his parents.

Domingo has 15 years of experience in agriculture, a trade that he learned from a young age from his parents because they had parcels of land where they worked and taught him. Now it's an honorable way for him to take care of his family. He works about 20 minutes from his home and goes out from 6:30am til noon. He also has a small flock of chickens that he fattens up.

Domingo needs a loan to buy concentrated feed for his chickens and to buy chicken wire to enclose them. He dreams of improving his home and growing his chicken farm.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for his chickens, and chicken wire to enclose them.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. Delma works very hard to provide for them. Delma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, personal care products and snack foods.

Delma has been in this business for 21 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. In the future, Delma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, personal care products and snack foods

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica al transporte de personas en un pick up, juntos tienen dos hijos los cuales estudian.

Ana, vende frutas y verduras desde hace cinco años, este trabajo lo aprendió cuando estuvo trabajando en la capital y se desempeñó en ventas en el mercado y cuando regreso decidió empezar un negocio propio; los mercados que visita están en pueblos diferentes, en total son cinco pueblos a los que ella va a vender y las distancias que recorre son bastante largas, las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante en un pick up y así visita a la mayor cantidad de clientes.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar un vehículo para transportar la mercadería, porque el que tiene es muy pequeño y no puede llevar mucho producto; con esto mejorará el negocio porque podrá transporte más mercadería a los mercados y así obtener más ingresos para la familia.

Ana, sueña con ver crecer el negocio y poder seguir vendiendo los productos en los mercados de los pueblos que visita; además sueña con que los hijos sigan estudiando y tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, studied until 4th grade. She is married and her husband works in transportation, driving passengers in a pick-up truck. They have two school-aged children.

Ana has been selling fruits and vegetables for 5 years. She learned the trade when she was working in the market in the capital. When she returned home, she decided to start her own business. She visits markets in different towns, going to 5 towns and driving long distances. She makes the sales by driving around in her pick-up truck and visiting customers.

Ana needs a loan to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise, because the one she has is small and can't carry a lot of product. This will improve her business because she will be able to carry more to the markets and therefore make more money for her family.

Ana dreams of growing her business, continuing to sell in the markets of the towns that she visits. She also dreams that her children will continue studying and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to transport merchandise.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 48 years old and married and has two children, who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Avelina has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Tilly

texts.en:
Tilly always knew she wanted to own her own business. She has a passion for helping women and the health and beauty industry, so she decided to become a Mary Kay consultant.

Tilly’s specialty is helping woman find the specific style of make-up that fits their lifestyle. She will be providing cosmetics and skin care, as well as woman’s accessories, to her customers.

Currently, Tilly has two part-time jobs. Her main source of income is working for a clothing and accessory store at a local mall. She also works as a part-time as a waitress and bartender at a popular music venue in town.

Through her employment, she feels she has a great advantage in connecting to a large clientele base, and through word-of-mouth advertising, she knows the business will thrive, as her customers are eagerly waiting for her to launch.

Tilly will use her Kiva loan to purchase a Mary Kay starter kit for product inventory and sampling. Tilly will also purchase a re-furbished Apple Laptop and use the remaining funds for future inventory and to complete orders.

loans.use: to purchase product inventory and a computer.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
San Diego’s South Bay Community Magazine is a new business established by Melissa. The magazine will be a monthly publication and an online newsletter that gives readers access to all the happenings in South County San Diego.

Melissa had the idea to start this business when she was looking around for free events to attend with her family in the area. She noticed that there wasn’t a consolidated place where she could go to see all the events and resources around her.

“I’m a connector,” says Melissa. “I can’t wait to share the passion that I have for my community with the residents and business owners in South County.”

The magazine will primarily feature and promote local events and stories that have not yet occurred as opposed to newspapers which generally report news stories that have already taken place. Also, Melissa will include stories on low cost or free recreational activities, which will promote health and wellness in the community.

Melissa will use the loan to start the design process and print a prototype issue to present to investors. She hopes that San Diego’s South Bay Community Magazine will be the next popular publication in the San Diego area.

loans.use: to start the design process and print a prototype issue to present to investors.

loans.name: Clara Sandra

texts.fr:
Clara Sandra est une femme mariée de 37 ans. Etant mère de 3 enfants dont les deux vivent auprès de son ex  mari. L’enfant né de son second mari ( 4 ans) est scolarisé dans une école privée, elle a pour objectifs :  l’extension de sa maison et sa réhabilitation en brique, ainsi que la sécurisation de son lieu de vente. 
Clara Sandra a travaillé avec différents opérateurs (AIRTEL /Orange) pour un taxi phone et vente de ces produits.  Suite à la formation qu’elle a suivi , elle a déjà créé une petite unité de production de caca pigeon  puis s’est adonné au taxi phone et vente de divers articles. Elle a une culture entrepreneuriale .Elle a 12ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. Elle a déjà été femme de ménage à l’étranger  et  a déjà travaillé dans une entreprise de zone franche.
texts.en: Clara Sandra is a 37 years old married woman. She is a mother of three children of which two live with her ex-husband. The child born from her second husband (4 years old) is enrolled in a private school. Her goals are: the extension of her home and renovation with bricks as well as securing her sales premises. Clara Sandra has worked with various operators (AIRTEL/ Orange) for a taxi phone [small business offering mobile phone calls] and sale of their products. After completing her training, she created a small production of caca pigeon [crispy fried snacks] and established a taxi phone and the sale of various items. She has an entrepreneurial culture. She has 12 years of experience in this field. She has been a housekeeper and has already worked in a free zone company.

loans.use: to purchase pre-paid mobile recharge cards (airtel, telma, orange), telma, orange and airtel mobile SIM cards, disposable tissues, eau vive, etc

loans.name: Yawa Ablewavi

texts.fr: Veuve et âgée de 39 ans, Yawa est une femme qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge. Résidant à Baguida, Yawa écrase de la farine de maïs et du manioc qu’elle produit en des boules de pâtes non préparer et le revend à son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Yawa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa production. Pour commander le sac de maïs et des paniers de poissons frit, Yawa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien revendre et de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants en les aidant à prendre en charge les frais scolaires dès le début de cette rentrée.
texts.en:
A 39-year-old widow, Yawa lives with her two children in Baguida. She crushes maize and cassava into flour to produce balls of uncooked paste. She then resells them from her home and by browsing the surrounding neighborhoods, to generate good financial returns. Twice a month Yawa resupplies with necessary products at the market.

Yawa is requesting this loan to order a sack of corn and baskets of fried fish. This will enable her to increase her sales and generate more income. She will be able to meet her children's needs, by taking care of their tuition fees as soon as school starts.

loans.use: buy one sack of maize and 34 baskets of fish.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquin es un hombre de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 4 años y su negocio es la tornería y soldadura.
Él es emprendedor, dinámico y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, donde existen parcelas y lotes destinados al engorde de ganado vacuno y equino, en medio del gigantesco crecimiento de la ciudad.
Joaquin es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní que acostumbra hablar en reuniones familiares y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la venta de comida y con su hijo que pronto entrará a la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la tornería y soldadura, realiza trabajos como; cepillo, prensadora, limadora, trenzas hidráulicas,  estructuras metálicas, plataformas, baldes, tuberías, accesorios, estaciones de bombeo, también funde toda clase de piezas en bronce y/o aluminio, y realiza todo tipo de soldaduras, su trabajo lo efectúa dentro y fuera de la ciudad, “la demanda constante de piezas metálicas hace que mi negocio mejore y al mismo tiempo me exige nuevas máquinas…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque realiza todo tipo de trabajos. La ventaja de su negocio es que existe demanda de repuestos y arreglos en soldadura, la desventaja es la falta de herramientas de trabajo. Su sueño es tener un negocio conocido por todo el mundo, el desea comprar una máquina de soldar, amoladora y rectificadora. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que  Joaquin solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de soldar, amoladora y rectificadora para su tornería.
texts.en:
Joaquin is a 26 year old man who lives with his partner. He has a 4 year old son and his business is a machine shop and welding. He is enterprising, dynamic, and very hard-working. His business is located in the southern zone of the city, where there are parcels and lots destined to fatten cattle and horses amidst great growth of the city. His first language is Guaraní which he speaks at family events and he speaks Spanish while out and in his business.

He shares his live with his wife who sells food and his son who will soon begin school. They live in a rented room built of brick that has potable water, electricity, and septic. His business is welding and a machine shop. He does jobs such as metal brushing, pressing, shaving, metal structures, platforms, tubes, pipes, accessories, pumping stations, etc. He also works in bronze and aluminium and does all kinds of welding; he works inside and outside the city. "The constant demand for metal pieces makes my business improve while also demanding new machines in order to do the work," he states.

His business is successful because he does all kinds of jobs. The benefit of his business is that there is demand for parts and welding repairs; the challenge is the lack of tools to do the work.

His dream is to have a well-known business. He wishes to buy a welding machine, grinder, and straightener for his machine shop. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years that he has had this business. It is for these reasons that Joaquin seeks a loan to buy a welding machine, grinder, and straightener for his machine shop.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine, grinder, and straightener for his machine shop.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 49 years old and single with two children, one of whom is still in school. Emelda works very hard to provide for them.

Emelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for one year.

In the future Emelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Diana Verónica

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer sonorense trabajadora de 29 años de edad. Es soltera, sin hijos y dedica su tiempo a ejercer su profesión como enfermera, la cual también le ha dado la oportunidad de impulsar su negocio.
Hace aproximadamente un año y medio, Diana tomó la decisión de crear un negocio de capacitación a particulares y empresas sobre salud, higiene y seguridad.  Aprovechando la necesidad de la sociedad de tener estos conocimientos y viéndolo como una fuente de ingresos extras para salir adelante, fue que Diana se motivó para arrancar su empresa. 
Con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio y tener más recursos para impartir sus cursos, Diana ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar equipos necesarios y material didáctico para impartir mejor sus consultorías.
Orgullosa de su negocio y del impacto que puede tener en la sociedad, Diana encuentra el impulso para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Diana, 29, is a hardworking Sonoran woman. She is single and has no children, and dedicates her time to her profession as a nurse. About a year and a half a go, Diana decided to create a training business for individuals and businesses about health, hygiene and safety. Her motive was to take advantage of a societal need for this information and have an extra source of income.

Diana asks for a loan to buy equipment and teaching materials needed to better carry out her trainings. She is proud of her business and the impact it can have on society, and feels compelled to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy needed equipment and teaching materials to improve her consultations.

loans.name: Dolores Erneides

texts.es:
Dolores, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato con opción de técnico en agricultura, está casado, su esposa también trabaja en la agricultura junto a él, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno de 15 años de edad está estudiando noveno grado.

Dolores, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de guayaba, cuando quedo desempleado empezó una pequeña plantación de 200 árboles de guayaba y al obtener buenos ingresos continuo extendiendo la plantación y ahora a logrado tener 1,000 árboles, de los que vende el producto todos los días, porque nunca dejan de producir y con los ingresos que le genera mantiene a su familia y le da mantenimiento a su cultivo. 

Dolores, necesita el préstamo para comprar 300 árboles más porque quiere expandirse más para cultivar 3,500 metros cuadrados de tierra, con lo que logrará una mejor producción.

Los sueños de Dolores, son hacer que el negocio siga creciendo y que los hijos sigan trabajando para que tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Dolores, 45, graduated from a baccalaureate program with a specialty as an agricultural technician. He is married and his wife also works in agriculture. Together they have 4 children, only one of whom is in school - in 9th grade, at age 15.

Dolores plants and harvest guava fruit. When he lost his job, he started a small plantation with 200 trees, and as he made a good profit he extended the plantation. Now he has 1000 trees from which he sells product every day, because they never fail to produce. With the income he takes care of his family and of his land.

Dolores needs a loan to buy 300 more trees because he wants to expand his crop to 3500 square meters of land. This will give him a better production.

Dolores's dreams are to have his business continue growing, and for his children to continue working to achieve a better future.

loans.use: to buy 300 more trees to cultivate 3500 square meters of land.

loans.name: Jesus Mi Salvador Group

texts.es: Félix es soltero dedicado a la venta de comida rápida en hora de la noche hace varios años.  Actividad que aprendió cuando trabajaba como ayudante de cocina. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas arroz aceite azúcar al por mayor. El grupo “JESUS MI SALVADOR” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Félix es la tercera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en: Félix is a single man who has worked selling fast food during nighttime hours for several years. He learned this activity while working as a kitchen helper. He will invest the loan in wholesale purchase of more rice, oil and sugar. The group "Jesus Mi Salvador" is grateful to KIVA investors for the credit offered. Félix is the third seated person from the right.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 42 years old and married with six children. With two of her children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell. Helen has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sylvia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from poultry.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra est une femme divorcée âgée de 30 ans résidant à Baguida. Avec deux enfants à charge, Abra est une revendeuse d’ignames frits et des fruits qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Abra sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de tubercules d’ignames, des cartons de spaghettis et des bassines d’oranges. Abra désire gagner  plus de bénéfice en mieux revendant afin de venir en aide à ses enfants aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: Abra is a 30 years old divorced woman residing in Baguida. With two dependant children, Abra is a retailer of fried yams and fruits. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market and resells it in front of her home. Abra is requesting this loan to order units of yams, spaghetti boxes and bowls of oranges. Abra wants to increase her profits by selling more in order to help her children with their various daily workloads.

loans.use: to buy 30 units of yams, 02 boxes of spaghetti and 02 bowls of oranges.

loans.name: Monica Aide

texts.en:
Monica is a 21 year old woman, she is single and living with her parents, she has no kids, nor economical dependents and she makes an income by working at a call-centre. Her parents give her some money every month in order to help her with her studies expenses.

Monica is studying business management at a local university. She is a very dedicated person, she can keep up to her responsibilities at work and has good grades at her career.

She is very thankful to her parents for all the support they provide for her.

Monica is willing to expand her house by building a new room. To achieve this she is looking for a 7,369.00 MXN loan, with it she will be able to increase her house value.

loans.use: to build a new room at her house

loans.name: Idalia Eugenia

texts.es:
Idalia, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de un hijo que estudia y es el único que depende de ella económicamente.

Idalia, se dedica a la venta de pasteles de carne, enchiladas, empanadas de plátano, etc. la necesidad de generar ingresos la ha llevado a emprender este negocio y le ha resultado bien, porque ella tiene conocimientos de cómo preparar las frituras y además vende productos de belleza por catálogo y también obtiene ingresos adicionales, el negocio lo tiene en casa y su horario de venta es por las tardes de 1:00 a 5:00 p.m.  

Idalia, necesita el préstamo para comprar papas, harina, aceite, yuca, entre otra materia prima para la elaboración de los platillos típicos.

El sueño de Idalia, es colocar un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Idalia is 47 years old and completed 6th grade. She is a single mom of a son who is in school and is the only economic dependent she has. Idalia makes meat pastries, enchiladas, banana turnovers, etc. The need to generate income drove her to start this business and it has gone well for her because she has knowledge in how to prepare the fried food. In addition she sells beauty products via catalog and also obtains additional income.

Her business is located in her home and her hours are in the afternoons from 1 PM - 5 PM. Idalia needs a loan to buy potatoes, flour, oil, yucca, and other ingredients in order to make her traditional food dishes. Idalia dreams of opening a larger business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, flour, oil, yucca, and other ingredients in order to make her traditional food dishes.

loans.name: Nahaen Group

texts.en: Nochan understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Nochan knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Nochan purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Nochan is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Naxai Group

texts.en:
Kong is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Kong and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Kong and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Kong and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Kong and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is a 35-year-old married mother of three children living in Calabayan, Ozamiz City with her family. She has made a living through her general store by selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns from these activities while her husband works in a private company.

In 2007 Girlie joined GDMPC and She has successfully repaid her previous loan. which was used to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery items for sale. A portion of her generated profit will be used to improve her house.

Girlie wishes that her children will be successful in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alma has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emeliza

texts.en:
Emeliza is 29 years old and is single with three children. Two of her children are currently in school. For the past five years, Emeliza has been in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed seven previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Emeliza is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school, Emie works very hard to provide for them.

Emie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell to her store like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other snack foods to sell.

Emie has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future Emie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell to her store like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other snack foods to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 61 years old, married with five children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Virginia has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Virginia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 23 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is married and she works hard to support herself.  For the past nine years, she has run a general store in the Philippines.

Marietta is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Villalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Villalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from retailing gasoline.  Villalyn is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell to her local market such as, cabbage, carrots, potato, banana, beans, etc for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Villalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell to her local market such as, cabbage, carrots, potato, banana, beans, etc

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a widowed woman, 67 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Evelyn has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is 45 years old lady, a responsible mother of five children and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own construction business for past 25 years. Shagufta's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandises e.g cement, concrete and bricks etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these merchandises.

To fulfill the need of her husband Shagufta has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy these merchandises for business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs
Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 54 years old, married with six children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Consolacion has a fishing business in the Philippines. Consolacion requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Consolacion has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Na Tau 26 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong, 31, is a Thai ethnic woman who has been married and the mother of three children: two girls at the age of 14 and 9, a boy at the age of 2. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her children in a Thai ethnic traditional house at a small remote village.

To provide for the crowded family and to send her children to school fully, Mrs. Phuong works very hard at agricultural production with several activities such as growing rice, producing edible canna, breeding pig, chicken, duck, fish, buffalo and cow while her husband works as a truck driver.

This is the fourth time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the pigs. She hopes that her investment will bring good income to her family so that she could support better her family. Mrs. Phuong dreams that her children will be successful in career and have a bright future. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 59-year-old married woman with four children. For the past seven years, she has run a tailoring business in the Philippines. Nora is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nora is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy textiles, needle accessories for tailoring, and cloth to maintain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to to buy textiles, needle accessories, and cloth to maintain her business

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 44 years old, married with three children.

Siony works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 33,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, personal care products and other snack foods.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Siony has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from weaving and food vending.

Siony aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchace more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, personal care products and other snack foods.

loans.name: Akoelé

texts.fr: Akoélé est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida. Agée de 40 ans, Akoélé vit avec quatre enfants à charge. Akoélé est une revendeuse de maïs et de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Akoélé nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Akoelé is a married woman residing in Baguida. Aged 40, Akoelé lives with four dependant children. Akoelé is a corn and charcoal retailer. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market and resells it at her home. To finance her purchase, Akoelé needs this loan to order bags of corn and charcoal in order to sell more and increase her profits to support her husband in family responsibilities and to provide a good education to their children.

loans.use: to buy 01 bag of corn and 08 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is maize farmer from Liman village. As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, Samaila has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare, which is five and a half times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, he can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Samaila is requesting a loan to buy food and clothing which will help eliminate pressure to sell maize for low prices at the time of harvest. He is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, Samaila hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alasan

texts.en:
Alasan is a maize farmer from Karofi village. As a Babban Gona member, Alasan is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alasan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Alasan can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alasan no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Alasan hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en:
Yunusa is a maize farmer from Sakadadi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yunusa is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yunusa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yunusa can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Yunusa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl de 38 años de edad vive al lado de su compañera de vida y su hija de 11 años de edad. Él es un padre responsable que para poder mantener la economía de su hogar se dedica a la venta de pan francés cada mañana, luego durante el resto del día se encarga de salir a vender minutas, estos negocios los ha manejado desde hace varios años y gracias a ello es bien reconocido en las comunidades en las que se desplaza ofertando sus productos. Saúl vive de forma muy humilde y busca la manera de poder mejorar su condición de vida por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un carretón para la venta de minutas. De este modo poder desplazarse de una manera más fácil hacia los distintos lugares en los que vende.
texts.en:
Saul is 38 years old and lives with his life partner and their 11-year-old daughter. He is a responsible father that in order to maintain the home finances, earns a living selling french bread every morning. Later, during the rest of the day, he goes out to sell minutas [flavored ice drinks]. He has managed these businesses for many years, and thanks to this he is well recognized in the communities that he goes through offering his products.

Saul lives in a humble manner and looks for a way to improve his living conditions. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy a cart for selling minutas. In this way he can travel in an easier manner towards the distant places where he sells.

loans.use: to buy a cart for selling minutas [flavored ice drinks].

loans.name: Tenning's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de  3 membres fait partie d'un banc villageois qui a été inauguré en octobre 2007. Elles des femmes du même village qui ont de bonnes relations et sont très solidaires. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce, l'agriculture et le commerce.
LABA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 4 garçons et d'une fille. Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis années. Elle tient une boutique chez elle dans son village.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 1 tonne de riz, 5 bidons d'huile, et autres produits divers (savons, détergents) pour renforcer son stock en vue de développer son activité. 
Les bénéfices générés serviront à rembourser son prêt, épargner au niveau du banc villageois, participer à la dépense quotidienne et enfin satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: This group of 3 members is part of a banc villageois inaugurated in October 2007. These women come from the same village, maintain good relationships and are very supportive. They work mainly in trade and agriculture. LABA standing in the right of the photo and raising her left hand is the representative of the group. She is 60 years old. She is married and has four sons and one daughter. She has been working in trade for many years. She runs a shop at home in her village. With the loan, she intends to buy 1 ton of rice, 5 oil cans and other miscellaneous products (soaps, detergents) to increase her stock in order to expand her business. The profits generated will be used to repay the loan, save at the banc villageois, participate in her daily expenses and finally meet her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of rice, 5 oil cans, soap and detergents

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ligaya is 60 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ligaya has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, vegetable, meat, fish, etc..

Ligaya has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ligaya would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, vegetable, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional tools and materials for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for 8 years now.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and materials for her repair shop business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Comfort has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Comfort would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Comfort can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Comfort will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Comfort is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Dopé est une femme mariée de 43 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mère de trois enfants, Dopé est une revendeuse des céréales et de charbon de bois. Dopé s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour atteindre ses objectifs. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et de charbons de bois, Dopé nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire en vue de bien revendre puis de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants en leur payant leurs frais scolaire.
texts.en: Dopé is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Baguida. She is the mother of three children and a retailer of cereals and charcoal. Dopé gets her supplies three times per month at the market and resells them in front of her home to meet her goals. Dopé needs this loan in order to finance her supplies, purchasing sacks of corn and charcoal, and to have a good profit margin, with the goal of selling well to be able to meet her children's needs by paying their school fees.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of corn and eight sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida. Agée de 40 ans, Akoko vit avec deux enfants à charge. Akoko est une revendeuse de maïs et de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Pour financer son achat, Akoko nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et des moyens sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Akoko is a married woman living in Baguida. She is 40 years old and lives with two children in her care. Akoko is a retailer of corn and charcoal who gets her supplies three times per month at the market and resells them from her home and in the surrounding neighborhoods. To finance her purchase [of supplies], Akoko needs this loan to buy sacks of corn and medium sacks of charcoal with the goal of selling well and making a greater profit in order to support her husband with the family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of corn and eight sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia started her perfume selling business, Mia and JJ Company, last year. Shortly after she started her business, she was laid off from her full-time job, which she had to support herself while she was starting her business.

Though she found success and a respectable second income from her perfume business, she had to put it on hold as she was looking for full-time employment, and she tried to keep as many hours as possible with her temporary position.

Recently, she accepted a new full-time job, and at the same time, her previous perfume clients were asking her to start up sales again. Now that she is in a stable employment situation, she plans to sell her merchandise again, after getting a little help to jump start the business.

Dalia will use her Kiva loan to purchase inventory, and to cover various start-up costs such as having her computer repaired, and other technology costs, as well as start an account to sell her merchandise via Facebook.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and to cover various start-up costs.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en:
Mrs. Hieu, 37, is a mother of two children. She has now decided to put a small store in her house. She needs a loan to buy candies, cookies, sodas, juices, corn, beans, rice, among other products to sell. Buying these items will ensure a greater number of clients since they will be able to find everything they need.

She dreams of improving her home because her house is made of adobe and has deteriorated a lot from the rain. She also wishes for her children to be able to keep going to school and graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to buy candies, cookies, sodas, juices, corn, beans, rice, among other products to sell.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en 2011. Il est composé de femmes très dynamiques et très solidaires qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
SOKHNA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont deux garçons et huit filles. Elle s'active dans l'embouche en collaboration avec son fils depuis des années. Elle se rend dans une localité prés de chez elle pour acheter et y revendre le bétail..
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter 2 bœufs qu'elle va engraisser au bout de 3 mois et les revendre. Elle fait ça deux fois pendant les  6 mois.Avec le reste elle achète de l'aliment de bétail.
Les bénéfices serviront à acheter de la nourriture pour la famille mais aussi construire une chambre chez elle et enfin acheter des moutons pour développer son activité d'embouche.
texts.en:
This group is part of the banc villageois that was established in 2011. It is made up of very energetic, united women who are active primarily in business and livestock farming.

Sokhna, standing at right in the photo with her left hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is married and the mother of 10 children, two boys and eight girls. Sokhna has been raising livestock in collaboration with her son for years. She goes to a small village nearby to purchase and to sell the cattle.

With her new loan, Sokhna is going to purchase two cows to fatten; after three months, she will sell them. She does this twice every six months. With the rest [of the loan], she will purchase feed for the cattle.

The profits [from the sale] will allow Sokhna to purchase food for the family as well as build a room at her home and purchase sheep to grow her livestock-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica desde hace 3 años a la agricultura siembra maiz y frijol, comercializa sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, etc. asi como muestra en la fotografia para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: The youth who has his face pixelated is 27 years old and lives in a high risk zone. He has worked for 3 years in agriculture, growing corn and beans. He sells his product in the neighboring towns and with his earnings he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. so he can continue with his work as shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 39-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and five sons and her husband has been doing his own butcher business for the past 15 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Nargis's husband wants to purchase animals for his butcher business but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore Nargis has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy animals for her husband's butcher business.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Edmarie is 19 years old and is fifth of five children in the family. Her mother, Marciana, supports the family through her buying and selling of dry goods business in the Philippines.

Edmarie is studying for a Bachelor of Agricultural Technology and is currently in the fourth of this four-year course.

Marciana is borrowing PHP 4,438 to pay tuition fees of the second semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Edmarie plans to graduate and be employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a single, hardworking woman who has dedicated years of her life to helping others. She has always tried to live within her means and is very proud of the modest home she bought in the 1970’s, where she plans to reside for the remainder of her life.

She has suffered a few setbacks that have affected her credit recently as she was forced to undergo major surgery which not only damaged her credit, but also affected her income for a period of time.

Marie has since recovered and is back to work. She has paid all of her medical collections and is back on track, but the damage done to her credit still lingers.

Recently, Marie’s air conditioner stopped working, and due to the age of the old, inefficient unit, it cannot be repaired. Marie works long hours and she wishes to enjoy her time spent at home; however, recently her home has been unbearable due to the heat and this has begun to affect her sleep.

Marie is hoping that SELF and KIVA can help her purchase a new high efficiency air conditioning unit that will be reliable and improve her quality of life. This loan will also help Marie rebuild her credit over time.

loans.use: acquire a new high efficiency air conditioning unit that will be reliable and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Yenmy Caridad

texts.es: Yenmy de 30 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y su hija de 11 años. Ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora quien presta sus servicios como cocinera en un restaurante y gracias a esto puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Yenmy en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, grava, lamina, madera y pago de mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda y ampliar el corredor, de esta manera ofrecerle una mejor forma de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Yenmy, who is 30 years old, lives with her partner and her 11 year-old daughter. She is a very responsible and hardworking person who works as a cook in a restaurant. Thanks to this job, she is able to cover her family’s basic necessities. Yenmy would like to improve her quality of life, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase sand, cement, gravel, metal roofing sheets, and wood, and to pay for labor in order to install a cement floor in her house and to expand the covered porch. In this way, she will be able to offer a better life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, gravel, metal roofing sheets, and wood, and to pay for labor in order to install a cement floor in her house and to expand her covered porch.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: Maria tiene 66 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 9 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, anteriormente habia solicitado un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia, nuevamente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y asi surtir con mas productos para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: Maria is 66 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has had a small store located in her home for 9 years. She has many customers because of the good prices. Previously she had asked for a loan to purchase merchandise, again she is asking for a loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc., so to stock up with more products to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives in Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She raises pigs and sells them to earn a living. She has been in this business for many years and earns 5,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in 2007. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase feeds and vitamins for the pigs. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and also to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy con 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a prestar servicio como carpintero,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 20 años. Adicionalmente cuenta con ganado lechero. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo,para la compra de madera para invertir en este negocio.

Fredy cuenta con experiencia crediticia, para Edpyme Alternativa es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Fredy, 45 years old, is partnered and lives in his family home with his partner and two children in Lagunas district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru. He has many good personal and work references from the people in the zone. The inhabitants of this place work primarily in agriculture, commerce, and raising animals.

He works as a carpenter with more than 20 years of experience in this field. Additionally, he has dairy cattle. He asks for the loan to have working capital, to purchase wood to invest in this business.

Fredy has loan experience, for Edpyme Alternativa, it is his second loan.

loans.use: to purchase wood to invest in this business.

loans.name: Lucelyn

texts.en:
Lucelyn is 57 years old, married, and has seven children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lucelyn has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Frezel

texts.en:
Frezel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Frezel is 39 years old and her three children are currently in school.

Frezel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Frezel requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Frezel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Genra

texts.en:
Genra is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Genra is 43 years old, and three of her children are presently in school.

Genra has a buying and selling of crabs and shrimp business in the Philippines. Genra requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy crabs and shrimp to sell to her customers.

Genra has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy crabs and shrimp to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 37 years old, married, and has three children who are presently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josie has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 47 years old and married with five children, three of whom are presently in school. Lucy works very hard to provide for them. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, personal care products and other snack foods.

Lucy has been in this business for four years. In the future she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, personal care products and other snack foods.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, se dedicó al trabajo de sastrería y por esa razón ya no siguió con sus estudios, está soltera, no tiene pareja porque su ex compañero de vida formó otra familia fuera del país; vive con sus tres hijos y sus dos suegros.

Rosa, es cosmetóloga desde hace 10 años, ella aprendió todo lo que sabe porque asistió a un curso y luego decidió dedicarse al negocio porque es una buena forma de generar ingresos para su familia, antes tenía otro negocio que era el de sastrería, pero luego se dedicó a la cosmetología y ahora el lugar donde trabaja está a 1 kilómetro de su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. 

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar 4 vitrinas para exhibir los productos que vende y comprara dos planchas de cabello, para tener más herramientas y brindar un mejor servicio. 

Rosa, sueña con que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rosa, 38 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. She worked in tailoring and for this reason, she didn't continue with her schooling anymore. She is single and doesn't have a partner because her ex-life partner started another family out of the country. She lives with her three children and her two parents-in-law.

Rosa has been a cosmetologist for 10 years. She learned everything that she knows because she attended a course and then decided to work at the business because it is a good way to generate income for her family. Before, she had another business, which was tailoring, but then she worked in cosmetology and now the place where she works is 1 kilometer from her house and her work schedule is from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.

Rosa needs the loan to purchase 4 display cases to show the products that she sells and to purchase two flat irons for hair to have more tools and offer a better service.

Rosa dreams that her business will grow and that her children can study for a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase 4 display cases to show the products that she sells and to purchase two flat irons for hair.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
Reyna is a strong, hardworking woman and full-time single mother. Her dream is to be able to put her son through college, but she would like to set the example by furthering her own education as well.

This is quite a feat considering how ill she was not so long ago. Reyna struggled with her health for some time, and was forced to pay for many of her medical expenses out of pocket. The cost of care became overwhelming and eventually began to negatively affect her credit rating.

Despite the many obstacles and the initial grim prognosis, she was able to recover quite well and is totally self-sufficient. She will continue to struggle for the rest of her life with her health, but she is currently doing very well and is ready to continue with her life plans.

While things are looking up for Reyna in a lot of ways, Reyna is currently experiencing an issue that she is hoping SELF and Kiva can help her fix. Her air conditioner is currently broken, and she is in need of a new unit.

The A/C replacement is very important for Reyna as her health condition is greatly affected by the heat. In order for Reyna’s health to remain stable, she needs to be able to retreat from the hot weather when it becomes unbearable for her.

With the damage to Reyna’s credit due to the mounting medical bills, she was unable to finance a new high efficiency air conditioning unit elsewhere. Reyna is hoping a KIVA loan can help improve her quality of life, preserve her health, and rebuild her credit.

loans.use: acquire a new high efficiency air conditioning unit which will greatly improve her quality of life and preserve her fragile health.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 37-year-old woman, and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession; her husband sells fruits, e.g., apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Nagina's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore, Nagina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is a 53-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and her husband is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Fazeelat has also been doing her business of cloth selling for the past 20 years and contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Fazeelat needs to buy different types of cloth for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in a position to buy this cloth for her business purposes.

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can purchase the cloth easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn a more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Fazeelat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her cloth business.

loans.name: Lalasoa

texts.fr:
Lalasoa vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit que vous lui avait accordé dernièrement. Ledit crédit lui a permis d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et ce qui entraine automatiquement l'augmentation des bénéfices et de revenu. De ce fait, elle a pu inscrire tous ses enfants dans des écoles privées cette année contrairement à l'année dernière, ils étaient scolarisés dans des école publiques. Le niveau de vie de la famille s'améliore donc petit à petit. 
L'objectif est de toujours avancer, encore développer l'activité, et avoir sa propre maison dans l'avenir car celle actuelle appartient à ses beaux-parents. Elle voudrait être indépendante et autonome.
texts.en:
Lalasoa thanks you very much for the previous loan you made to her. This loan allowed her to increase her working capital, which has definitely increased her profits and revenue. As a result, she has been able to enroll all of her children in private school this year, as opposed to last year, when they attended public school. Lalasoa's family's quality of life is thus increasing little by little.

The goal is always to improve, continue to grow the business, and have her own house in the future since the one [she lives in] now belongs to her in-laws. Lalasoa would like to be independent and self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase sandals and shoes as well as several kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Maria Ayde

texts.es: María de 52 años de edad vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su madre de 87 años y su nieto de 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora quien para obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener la economía del hogar ha instalado una pequeña tienda, además como otra fuente de ingresos posee un negocio de venta de tortillas, ambos negocios los ha tenido desde hace varios años y gracias a ello ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. María vive en una vivienda muy humilde y con el paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, madera y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo de su vivienda. Logrando de esta manera ofrecerles una mejor forma de vida a su madre y a su nieto.
texts.en: María, 52 years old, lives at the side of her life partner, her 87-year-old mother and her 12-year-old grandson. She is a hard-working woman who, to get the necessary income to support her household economy, has established a small store. In addition, as another source of income, she has a business selling tortillas. She has had both businesses for some years and, thanks to that, she has been able to get her family ahead. María lives in a very humble house and, with the passing of time, it has deteriorated so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in metal sheeting, wood, and to pay labor costs to repair the roof of her house, managing in this way to offer a better manner of living to her mother and grandson.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood and to pay labor costs to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
Ce membre fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré le 6 juin 2011. Il regroupe des femmes de même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations et sont très solidaires, qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
OUMY sur la photo est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 4 garçons et 3 filles. Elle s'active dans l'embouche depuis des années.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 4 moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre au bout de 5 mois. Avec le reste du prêt elle achète de l'aliment de bétail.
Avec les bénéfices, elle envisage d'aider son mari dans les charges familiales en achetant de la nourriture et des vêtements pour la famille, mais aussi assurer la scolarité des enfants
texts.en: This member is part of the banc villageois inaugurated on June 6, 2011. It brings together women from the same village and surrounding areas who have good relations and are very supportive. They work mainly in trade and livestock fattening. OUMY in the photo is 30 years old, married and mother of 4 boys and 3 girls. She works in livestock fattening for years. With the loan, she intends to buy four sheep that she will breed and resell after 5 months. With the rest of the loan she will buy livestock feed. With the profits, she plans to help her husband with the family expenses by purchasing food and clothes for the family, but also to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep

loans.name: Consuelo Raquel

texts.es:
Consuelo con 51 años de edad ,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta al por menor de gaseosas y cervezas,desde hace más de 08 meses, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo, invertir en arreglos y mejoras de su hogar y otros gastos personales. De esta manera obtendrá una mayor calidad de vida para el bien de su familia.

Consuelo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 51 years old, is partnered and lives in her own house with her partner in the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru, in a rural zone. She has many good personal and work references from the people in the zone. The inhabitants of this place work primarily in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

She has worked selling soft drinks and beer retail for over 8 months. Her business is located in her home. She asks for a loan to invest in fixed assets, to invest in repairs and improvements to her home and other personal expenses. In this way she will get a better quality of life for the good of her family.

Consuelo is a returning borrower for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets, she will invest in repairs and improvements to her home and other personal expenses.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María Hilda con 35 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa alquilada, de material rústico,en el distrito de La Peca,provincia de Bagua,departamento de Amazonas, en una zona rural. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa como camisas,blusas,pantalones,etc. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su negocio. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

María Hilda es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María Hilda is 35 years old and a single mother. She lives in a rented house made of rustic materials, in the La Peca district, Bagua province, Amazonas department, in a rural area. She has very good personal and work references from people who live in the area. The inhabitants of the area work mostly in agriculture, commerce, and cattle ranching.

She sells clothing, such as t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to stock her business. This investment will allow her to earn greater profits and improve her economic condition, and therefore allow her to improve her living conditions.

María Hilda is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise, in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school. Jeneth works very hard to provide for them.

Jeneth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, etc.

Jeneth has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Jeneth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchace more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 30 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jeniffer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and has five children. She is married and three of her children are currently in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maria has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are currently in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marites has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 22, is a single woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish nets, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old woman, the mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her elder son is a fruit seller by profession, selling apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her son is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nasreen's son needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn the maximum profit, but due to an unfavorable financial position, her son is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.

Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her son to purchase the above items for his business purposes. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her son to increase his fruit business.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 35-year-old married woman, living along with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore,Pakistan.

Her husband has been driving a wagon for many years, providing pick-up and drop-off services to school students. In the evening, he provides a service loading and unloading goods and services on demand.
