The wagon he uses does not belonging to him; he has to pay a monthly fare to the owner. After this expense, he does not have enough cash left to meet his household's expenses.

Therefore, he wants to buy a new wagon of his own, but with the amount of money he has, he is still short. This is the reason Ghazala has requested a Kiva loan, so that her husband can buy a new wagon. In this way; he can get the maximum reward for his efforts without the need to pay monthly rent. 

Ghazala is very pleased after receiving this loan; she will always praise her supporting lenders.

loans.use: to buy a wagon for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 35-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of 1 child. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 12 years and he is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Saima's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. However, due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes.

Therefore, Saima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and it will also be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband in buying more supplies for his general store business.

loans.name: Simonette Claudine

texts.fr:
Simonette vous remercie beaucoup de tout son cœur pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé dernièrement. Ledit crédit lui a permis d'améliorer son fonds de roulement, augmenter et diversifier davantage les articles de ventes : friperie, peluches et sacs dames de seconde main. La famille a pu louer une autre maison beaucoup plus propre et grande. Elle a pu renouveler quelques immeubles avec ses épargnes.
Elle est devenue beaucoup plus motivée qu'auparavant, elle devient beaucoup plus passionnée de son activité, elle voudrait continuer à avancer et lutter d'où la raison de sa nouvelle demande de crédit afin de pouvoir développer davantage l'activité.
texts.en:
Simonette thanks you very much, with all her heart, for the previous loan she received. This loan allowed her to increase her working capital, as well as to expand and diversify the items she sells: second-hand clothing, plush toys, and ladies' purses. The family was able to rent another, much cleaner and larger house. Simonette was able to replace several furnishings with her savings.

Simonette has become much more motivated than before, and is becoming much more enthusiastic about her business. She would like to continue to fight to make progress, which is the reason she is requesting this new loan in order to be able to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand ladies' purses, plush toys, and leotards.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales(pollos y cerdos) desde hace 15 años, también se dedica a la venta de frutas, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, anteriormente solicito un credito para construir un corral, en esta ocasion solicita el credito para la compra de mas cerdos y asi seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Carmen is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her partner. She has been raising livestock animals (chickens and pigs) for 15 years. She also sells fruit. She sells her products in neighboring towns, and with what she earns she is able to cover some of her household’s expenses. She has previously requested a loan to build a corral. This time she is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and so she can continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 45 years old and married with six children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Mary Ann has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 48 years old and married with five children, three of whom are still in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, snack foods, shampoo and personal care products.

In the future Melanie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, snack foods, shampoo and personal care products.

loans.name: Mary Nyn

texts.en:
Mary Nyn is a widowed woman with nine children. She is 50 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Mary Nyn is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishnet, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Mary Nyn has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishnet, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel started F.A. Cleaning Services more than a year ago, after working for a large contracting company that was the sole builder for a large home developer in San Diego.

Due to the recession, Fidel’s company was having trouble securing work, so he wanted to do something to be more self-sufficient. It was then he decided to start his own cleaning service business, as he felt that going back into construction was not going to be enough to help provide for his family.

Father of three, Fidel wants to build up his business, so he can provide a steady income. Fidel will use his loan to purchase more commercial cleaning contracts, which will expand the amount of income for his business and allow him to later hire an employee.

loans.use: to purchase more commercial cleaning contracts, which will expand the amount of income for his business and allow him to later hire an employee.

loans.name: Meldie

texts.en:
Meldie works hard to support her family. Meldie is single with two children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Meldie requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials, such as fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Meldie has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Meldie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials such as fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Melanie is 32 years old and has one child still in school.

Melanie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like a fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat.

Melanie has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like a fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Yaneth Araceli

texts.es:
Yaneth, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen tres hijos, dos estudian en su casa.  

Yaneth, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y es la mano derecha de su esposo en los cultivos de maíz, frijol y maicillo; aprendió a cultivar desde que estaba joven, pues sus padres se encargaron de enseñarle esta actividad, el lugar donde siembra está a 2 kilómetros de su casa y su horario de trabajo es de 4 a 5 horas al día. 

Yaneth, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, para aprovechar los residuos de la cosecha agrícola que pronto sacara y así tener otra fuente de alimentación cuando de la vaca de leche. 

Yaneth, sueña con ver a sus hijos crecer y que estudien y sean profesionales, además sueña con tener muchas vacas para dedicarse a vender leche y queso.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 28 years old and she finished through sixth grade. Her partner works in agriculture, they have three children, of whom two are studying at home.

Yaneth works as a homemaker and is her husband’s “right hand” when it comes to farming corn, beans, and sorghum. She learned to farm when she was very young because her parents taught her how. The place where she farms is 2 kilometers from her house. Her work schedule is from 4 to 5 hours per day.

Yaneth needs the loan to buy a dairy cow, so she can take advantage of the byproducts of the agricultural harvest, which will be ready soon, and thereby have another source of food when the cow produces milk.

Yaneth dreams of seeing her children grow up, study, and become professionals. She also dreams of having many cows so she can sell milk and cheese.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, ella vive con sus padres y sus cuatro hijos que están estudiando. 

Arminda, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y desde hace tres años es la encargada de hacer la comida para los alumnos de una escuela, pero ahora que ya terminó la jornada estudiantil ella ha decidido trabajar en el mercado de la ciudad haciendo tortillas. 

Armida, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y una cocina para hacer tortillas para vender, esto le ayudara mucho porque tendrá ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.

Los sueños de Armida, son tener salud y seguir apoyando a los hijos para que terminen sus estudios y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Arminda is 35 years old and completed 6th grade. She is a single mother of 4 children. She lives with her parents and four children who are in school. Arminda does the household chores and for 3 years has been in charge of the food for the students in a school. But now that the school year has finished she has decided to work in the city market making tortillas.

Arminda needs a loan to buy corn and a kitchen in order to make tortillas to sell. This will help her a lot because she will have income to cover her children's needs. Arminda dreams of having good health and continuing to support her children so that they finish their education and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy corn and a kitchen in order to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 53-year-old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 4 children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family. Yasmeen is also providing sewing services to earn income to contribute with her husband to support the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc for her business purposes. However, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also to help increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is a 60-year-old lady, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand-in-Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings on enterprise development, savings and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is maize, beans and poultry farming. She has applied for a Kiva loan to enhance her poultry keeping business, by buying poultry feeds. She says that this will increase her level of income and help her continue supporting her family’s basic need such as food.

Mirriam is very grateful to Kiva and it's lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds, hence increase income to continue supporting the family's basic needs such as food.

loans.name: Mazlooma

texts.en:
Mazlooma is a 24-year-old woman and the mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, selling apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He alone is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Mazlooma's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase fruits. Mazlooma has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruit for her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Miarintsoa Eliane

texts.fr: Miarintsoa vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé dernièrement. Avec le crédit, elle a pu augmenter les quantités des viandes de bœufs étalés et vendus. Elle peut même faire de la vente en gros auprès des petits revendeurs. Elle est contente du résultat et voudrait encore continuer à avancer. De toute façon le rêve d'avoir sa propre maison reste toujours son objectif, donc elle ne s'arrêtera pas tant que ce rêve ne se réalisera. C'est une femme courageuse et travailleuse et ne baissera jamais facilement ses bras.
texts.en: Miarintsoa says thank you very much for the loan you had granted her. With this loan, she was able to increase the amounts of beef put up for sale and sold. She can even sell in bulk to small-scale retailers. She is happy with the results and would still like to continue forward. In any case, her goal is still to have a house of her own, so she will keep going until this dream is realized. She is a brave and hard-working woman who will never easily give up.

loans.use: to buy some beef steaks.

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
Sarwar’s son owns a vehicle spare parts shop in which he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He sells brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient amount to afford household expenses.

Her son is only a single person who has to support his family and old parents. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with the future expenses. Therefore, Sarwar has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her son.

Sarwar is the mother of six children; some of them are very young and fully dependent on their parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her children. She hopes that her son will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. Sarwar thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights and batteries for her son's auto spare parts shop.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 30 years old and has three children. Nemia is married and has one child still in school.

Nemia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Nemia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Nemia has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 38-year-old woman and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits, e.g.: Apples, Bananas, Grapes, etc. Her husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Musarat's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose, so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore Musarat applied for a Kiva loan from it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can help her husband purchase the above items for business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
Ana es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, y su negocio es la confección de ropa.
Ella es alegre, feliz y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ que se caracteriza por su tradicional feria los días jueves y domingo, donde se dice se puede encontrar desde una aguja hasta un camión.
Ana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que pronto entrará en la escuela, viven en casa de sus padres que es propia y está construida de adobe, cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de ropa para hombre, prendas tales como trajes, abrigos, chaquetas, chamarras e impermeables, actividad que realiza en un cuarto habilitado como taller de costura en su mismo domicilio, “los colores y diseños cambian, según a la temporada y a la moda, es algo con lo que debemos estar al día, de eso también dependen mis ventas…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque vende por mayor a comerciantes minoristas. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de material de trabajo como telas, botones, hilos, cierres y otros. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta, ella desea comprar tela por rollo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar tela por rollo para confeccionar ropa masculina y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Ana is 21 years old, single, and has a 4 year-old son. Her business is sewing clothing.

She is joyful, happy, and very entrepreneurial. Her business is located in the 16th of July neighborhood, which is characterized by its traditional markets on Thursdays and Sundays, where you can buy anything from a needle to a truck. 

Ana is dark, has long black hair, and is thin. Her first language is Aymará, which she speaks at home. She speaks Spanish as the common language and in her business. She lives with her son, who will soon start school. They live in her parents’ house, which they own, and which is made of adobe. The house has running water, electricity, and is connected to the municipal sewer. 

Her business is the making of clothing for men, such as suits, coats, jackets, overcoats, and raincoats. She works in a room in her house that is set up as a sewing workshop. “The colors and designs change, according to the season and fashion. It’s something we have to stay up-to-date with, my sales depend on that,” she comments. 

Her business is successful because she sells to wholesalers. The advantage of her business is that she sells at wholesale, and the disadvantage is the lack of work materials, such as fabrics, buttons, threads, zippers, and other items. Her dream is to have her own place to sell her clothing, and she wants to buy fabric by the roll. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years that she’s been in this business.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy fabric by the roll, in order to make men’s clothing and sell it at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fabric by the roll in order to make men’s clothing and sell it at wholesale.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar is a young and hardworking woman. She was born in year 1988. Gavhar is married and has two children. She is a very careful mother for her children. 

Gavhar has owned a business, dealing with animal husbandry, for five years. Gavhar buys cows, feeds them for some months and sells them in a local market. She does not have a cowshed in her house, so she feeds cows in the mountains as her house is located near the mountains. 

Gavhar’s husband and father-in-low help her with managing the business. She is going to increase her working capital, and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase working capital.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra lives in Lahore. She is 39, married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services locally. He is a loving and responsible father as well. Their children are in school.

Azra's husband is the sole earner in the family so he has to bear all the financial burden. He works really hard to make ends meet. Currently his rickshaw's engine needs some important parts, and the tires need to be replaced as they have deteriorated due to constant driving. This has affected his income as well. He is short of money to buy new tires. Therefore Azra has requested a loan through Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband.

Though they have low income, Azra's husband is satisfied and content that he is capable of earning and is looking forward to more opportunities to raise more income. He plans to save money to buy a new rickshaw to rent out in the future.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw tires and some engine spare parts for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Молодая дехканка района Кубадиен это Малохат. Ей 21 лет, она самостоятельная, активная и шустрая девушка. Малохат замужем и имеет детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. Он решил сделать карьеру загранице. Малохат на районе живет вместе родителем и детьми. Ее дети еще маленькие. Малохат трудится на земле. Она занимается растениеводством не менее 4 лет. Малохат за счет дохода кормить, и одевает  своих детишек. Ей в работе помогает ее мама. Малохат решила взять кредит и приобрести несколько количество минеральных удобрений для обработки земельный участок. Минеральные удобрения помогает собрать богатый и качественный урожай. С такими планами Малохат просит небольшую саму денег.
texts.en:
This is Malohat, a young farmer from the Qubadiyon region. She is 21 and an independent, active and smart young woman. She is married and has children. Her husband is working in Russia to earn money and care for his family. He decided to develop his career abroad. Malohat lives with her parents and children, who are still small. She works the land and has been working in agriculture for no less than four years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Her mother helps her with her work.

Malohat has decided to take out a loan to buy some mineral fertilizer to improve the soil on her land. The fertilizer will allow her to harvest rich and high-quality crops. She is asking for a small amount of money to fulfil these plans.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Abdurazzok

texts.ru: Абдураззок 33 летный, отец 5 летного ребенка. Он из района Н. Хусрав. Абдуразок родился и вырос в семье дехканов. Его родители были дехканами, сейчас они уже пенсионеры не имеют работу.  Абдураззок освоил все навыки своего отца и идет по его стопам. Он занимается животноводством. Абдураззок 4 года продвигает свою работу. Он выращивает мелко рогатого скота. Абдураззок хорошо ухаживает о домашних животных. Он покупает молодых телят и откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Абдураззок берет советы от своего отца. У него осталось малое количество скотов. Абдураззок хочет приобрести  скотов для продвижения деятельностью. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему увеличить поголовья скотов и сохранить деятельность. В дальнейшем Абдураззок за счет дохода от животноводства хочет построить большой коровник и расширить животноводческую деятельность. У него большие планы в будущем. Он надеется на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Abdurazzok is 33 and the father of a five-year-old child. He is from the N. Khusrav region. He was born and raised in a family of farmers. His parents farmed, though now they are retired and don't work. He has mastered all his father's skills and followed in his footsteps. He has been working in animal husbandry for four years, raising livestock. He takes good care of his animals. He buys young calves and fattens them over several months, then sells them at the cattle market. His father advises him.

Abdurazzok has only a few animals left. He wants to buy livestock to continue his business. The loan amount requested will help him increase his head count of livestock and keep his business going. In the future, with the income from his animal husbandry, he wants to build a big cow shed and expand his animal husbandry business. He has big plans for the future. He hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to increase his head count of livestock and keep his business going

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia con 28 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo,en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, pollos, gallinas, cuyes, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como pollos,gallinas,etc, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Julia es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido tres créditos de S/.500,00; S/.500,00 y S/.1000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Julia is 28 years old and lives with her husband and her son in a rural area in Otoyún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru. She has very good personal and work references from people who live in the area. The inhabitants of the area work mostly in agriculture, commerce, and cattle ranching.

Julia raises and sells animals such as ducks, roosters, young chickens, hens, guinea pigs, etc. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business. Her business is located in her home. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals, such as roosters, young chickens, hens, etc. This investment will help her to have a greater variety of animals and more productivity, which will have a big influence on her business. She plans to increase her number of animals so she can tend to the diverse needs and wants of her clients in the area.

Julia is a recurrent borrower at Edpyme Alternativa. She has had  three loans: 500,000 PEN (Peruvian Nuevo Sol), 500,000 PEN, and 100,000 PEN, which she has repaid in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy animals such as roosters, young chickens, hens, etc.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su nieta, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 61 years old and lives in her own house with her granddaughter. She has been making and selling pupusas [tortillas with a variety of fillings] for 15 years. Her business is located in her home, in an area that gets a lot of traffic. With what she earns she is able to cover some of her household’s expenses. She is requesting a loan in order to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients so that she can continue with her work, which generates good income.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
MARIA FLOR, tiene 35 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "San Lorenzo" formado por ocho socios, grupo con poco tiempo de formado pero que hasta la fecha están demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en el cumplimiento del pago de sus cuotas.
Maria flor, se dedica a la atención de su negocio propio, es una bodega, que ha ido creciendo poco a poco, con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo para poder ir surtiéndolo de a pocos.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos como abarrotes, golosinas y bebidas para surtir y aumentar su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Maria Flor is 35 years old. She is a member of the San Lorenzo Group, made up of 8 members. The group has not been formed for long, but to date, they have shown responsibility and punctuality in complying with their installment payments.

Maria Flor makes her living waiting on her own business. It is a store that has been growing little by little, with hard work and a great deal of effort to keep stocking it bit by bit.

The loan received will be invested in the purchase of products, such as groceries, candy and drinks to supply and increase her stock of products.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of products for her store.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis con 54 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 15 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de sus finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Luis es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luis is 54 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the Colasay district, Jaén province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. He has very good personal and work references from people who live in the area. The inhabitants of the area work mostly in agriculture, commerce, and cattle ranching.

Luis works in agriculture, specifically coffee farming. He has more than 15 years of experience in this business. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer so he can maintain his coffee farm. This way he will have improved yields.

Luis is a recurrent borrower with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Antonia De Jesus

texts.es: Antonia de 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive al lado de sus hijas de 22 y 18 años y su hijo de 14 años, por quienes se esfuerza día con día para que no les falte nada y puedan tener todo lo necesario para vivir bien. Antonia es una persona muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su comunidad, actividad que le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para los gastos de su hogar. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 26 años y ello le permite que las personas de su comunidad la prefieran y hace que la demanda a sus productos haya aumentado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de maíz para su negocio de venta de tortillas y de esta forma poder aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonia is 47 years old and is a single mother living with her daughters, ages 22 and 18, and her son, 14. She works hard day after day so they don't do without anything and can have everything needed to live well.

Antonia is a very hard-working person who makes her living selling tortillas in her community. This business allows her to obtain the income necessary for the household expenses. She has had this business for 26 years, and that means the people in her community prefer her, which means the demand for her products has increased.

So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of corn for her business selling tortillas so she can increase her profits.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of corn for her business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 57 years old. She is married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Consolacion is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Consolacion requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Consolacion has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Consolacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Adrian De Jesus

texts.es: Adrian de 50 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su hija de 17 años y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia quien ha instalado una tienda en su comunidad la cual administra desde hace 8 años y es así como mantiene la economía de su hogar. Adrian solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: gaseosas, golosinas, pan, frutas, etc. para surtir su negocio y de esta manera poder aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Adrian is 50 years old, lives in his own house with his life companion, his 17-year-old daughter and his 6-year-old son. He is a very hard-working man and very dedicated to his family.

He installed a store in his community, which he has been managing for 8 years, and that is how he supports the household budget.

Adrian is requesting this credit from FUSAI to invest in soft drinks, candy, bread, fruits, etc. to stock his business, and in this way, increase sales.

loans.use: to invest in soft drinks, candy, bread, fruits, etc. to stock his business.

loans.name: Gladis Eliazbeth

texts.es: Gladis de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso domestico desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de guacales, ollas, granos basicos entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Gladis is 49 years old and she lives in her own house with her life partner. She has worked selling household products for 15 years. Her business is located close to her place of residence and with her earnings she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy crates, pots and basic grains amongst other things. Then she can continue with her sales which generate good profits.

loans.use: to buy crates, pots and basic grains amongst other things.

loans.name: Christine Merriam

texts.en:
Christine Merriam is 35 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Christine Merriam works very hard to provide for them.

Christine Merriam runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Christine Merriam has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, rice, detergent soap, shampoo, candies, snack foods, etc.

In the future, Christine Merriam would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 37 years old and has two children. Analiza is married, and her two children are in school.

Analiza is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Analiza has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Andreana

texts.en:
Andreana is 62 years old and has 10 children. Andreana is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Andreana is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Andreana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Andreana has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Andreana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a hardworking man who earns a living through making hollow blocks. He is a 47-year-old married man and has six children, whom two are still attending school. He resides in the town of Dulag, Leyte.

Hollow blocks sales are at peak in his locality, due to the high demand for concrete housing materials.

Edgardo decided to join CEVI to access loans and to invest in supplies like sand and gravel and pay for laborers. These are vital to his livelihood. They will augment his income and let him continue to manage his business. In that way, he can provide his family with a nutritious diet and finance the schooling of his children.

He is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to invest in supplies like sand and gravel and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 47 years old and married with two children.

Julita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Julita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Julita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Duena

texts.en:
Duena is 44 years old and married.

Duena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Duena has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Duena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise by catalog.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Diosdada is 60 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Diosdada has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

Diosdada has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 31 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Geraldine works very hard to provide for them.

Geraldine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Geraldine has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, rice, eggs, soft-drinks, candies, milk, coffee, etc.

In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Berta Rosalva

texts.es: Berta de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de minutas desde hace 16 años vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y adicional a eso tambien vende ropa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventaralgunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de marquetas de hielo, jaleas de sabores, vasos, cucharas, entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Berta is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her son. She has been making a living selling shaved ice for 16 years. She sells door to door in the various neighborhoods and in addition to that, she sells clothing.

With the profits she makes, she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy blocks of ice, flavored jellies and syrups, cups, spoons and other things, so she can continue with her sales to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy blocks of ice, flavored jellies and syrups, cups, spoons and other things.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Margarita is 35 years old.

Margarita has a business of selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Margarita requested a loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Margarita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old and married with three children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 23,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sacks of rice, home care products, and other groceries.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like sacks of rice, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 36 years old and married with three children.

Mylene earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 40,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mylene has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and has six children. She is a married woman.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy pigets, feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gloria has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigets, feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. She has been in this business for 45 years now.

Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 55 years old and has five children. Vilma is married and has one child who is still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ameuefina

texts.en:
Ameuefina is 67 years old and married with six children.  Ameuefina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, shampoo, personal care products and other snack foods.

Ameuefina has been in this business for two years.

In the future Ameuefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchace more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices and milk.

loans.name: Santos De Paz

texts.es: Santos de 63 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida. Ella es una persona muy tenaz y muy responsable quien se dedica a la venta de frutas de forma ambulante, este negocio lo administra desde hace 30 años, lo que le permite ser muy reconocida en su comunidad y en las comunidades vecinas, además también se dedica a criar y vender cerdos y gallinas. En busca de mejorar sus ingresos Santos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: naranjas, papayas, sandillas, melones, etc. para aumentar la mercadería y así también sus ventas.
texts.en:
Santos, 63 years old, lives alongside her life partner. She is a very tenacious and responsible person, who works by selling fruits on the streets. She has been in this business for 30 years, which has led to her being very well recognized in her community and neighboring communities. 

In addition, she raises and sells pigs and chickens. Looking to improve her income, Santos is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner FUSAI to invest in: oranges, papayas, watermelons, melons, etc., to increase her merchandise and also her sales.

loans.use: to invest in: oranges, papayas, watermelons, melons, etc., to increase her merchandise and also her sales.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de mariscos y conchas, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas maricos, pescado y conchas para seguir con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economico.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 38 years old, and lives in his own house with his life partner and son. He has been working for 10 years by selling seafood and clams. He sells them on the street in the various neighborhoods near his home. With his earnings, he meets his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy more seafood, fish, and clams, to continue with his sales and therefore have better income.

loans.use: to buy more seafood, fish, and clams.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 28 years old and married.

Liezel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Liezel has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Liezel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Somsaard Group

texts.en:
Phedsamee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Phedsamee and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Phedsamee and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Phedsamee and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Phedsamee and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 40-year-old married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Julieta has a general store business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Julieta has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 35 years old and has four children. Emma is married and has four children who are in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emma has been farming corn for 4 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nafisakhon

texts.en:
Nafisakhon is divorced. She is careful mother of 3 children who are non-adults. Nafisakhon lives with her children in the South part of Tajikistan. She always tries for well-being of her children.

Nafisakhon 2 years ago started own business deal with buying and selling men clothes. She has a point of sale in a local market. Nafisakhon periodically renews the assortment of her goods. She sells fashionable clothes and in this way she attracts clients. Nafisakhon is going to buy men's clothes for new season and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy men's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Shohruh

texts.en: Shohruh is young and clever man and was born in 1995. Shohruh is single and lives with parents. He is a student of the third course. Shohruh studies Engineering at the Technical University of Tajikistan. He is one of the best students and he takes part in many university competitions. Shohruh is the repeated client of IMON and previous year he paid his university tuition thanks IMON. Shohruh is asking for a loan of 4500 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: pay for tuition for a Bsc. in Engineering

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira was born in 1981 year. She is married and has 3 children. Munira lives with her family together in North Tajikistan. She has higher education and she works in a kinder-garden as an up-bringer. Munira likes her job and she makes her job well. Now, she is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy medicines because she is ill and she really needs to financial support. Munira awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Ermenia

texts.en:
Ermenia is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ermenia is 47 years old and she has four children who are currently in school.

Ermenia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ermenia requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ermenia has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is 39 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Isabel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items for resale such as cigarettes, canned goods, junk  foods, homecare products and other groceries. Isabel has been in this business for 2 years now and sells a variety of items. In the future, Isabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items for resale such as cigarettes, canned goods, junk  foods, homecare products and other groceries

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is 46 years old, married and has one child.

Rogelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rogelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rogelyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rogelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Roydal

texts.en:
Roydal is a married woman, 32 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.


Roydal has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Roydal requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Roydal has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 46 years old and has seven children, four of which are currently in school. Emily is married.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Emily has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en: Martinha is a business women and she has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as shampoo, milks, biscuits, pens, sardines,noodles, coffee, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. Because she has plan to open a big store in the future. Martinha started to open her kiosk a few year ago, with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She will keep the spirit to run her business with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, milks, biscuits, pens, sardines,noodles, coffee, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara and her partner have lived in their home with their family for over ten years. The house they live in is their pride since they have built it with the effort of every day working hard baking bread and other goods and selling them door by door. However after 10 years of using a latrine and taking showers with buckets, they are ready to build their bathroom. Clara is sure this addition will give the family a healthier lifestyle and more privacy. The family is really seeing this credit as an opportunity to fast forward another couple years that will take them to save the money needed for the construction. With this credit they will also finish off the house walls and avoid wind and water coming through the cracks.

To them this is a unique opportunity since their job is informal and income is not guaranteed, they do not have access to credit from other institutions. With the credit they will also receive visits from certified technicians who will provide technical assistance and ensure that the construction meets all the safety and quality standards. Clara believes that this new improvement will help her family thrive and will make her feel even more proud of what she has been able to accomplish through her hard work.

loans.use: to, after 10 years on living in their house,  build a bathroom and experience privacy

loans.name: Bakilana Group

texts.en:
UPENDO who is in her late 20's is single and has no child. She has been running an electronic money transfer business for three years now. She works from 07 am to 06 pm daily and is able to make make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her business and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing great. She used the profit to take care of herself, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on m-pesa and tigo pesa to serve more customers. She dreams of expanding her business,

Upendo will share this loan with her loan group BAKILANA which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on m-pesa and tigo pesa to serve more customers.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 47 years old, married and had a child. They lived at Solana. Benjamin gets income through a farming business he manages. In his rice-field, he plant and harvest rice to sell. He wanted to continue improving his crop production and attain good profits someday. With this, Benjamin is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides use in farming. This will help improve good crop growth and nutrition. He also promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides use in farming

loans.name: Jalyn

texts.en:
Jalyn lives in Baga, Pana-on. She is a widow and unfortunately no children. Her neighbors find her a family – oriented person. She lives with her parent and she’s the one taking good care & supporting their needs. Jalyn engages into different kind of businesses like retail business, swine fattening & cattle raising. The income she earned from the said businesses helps her a lot in supporting the needs of the family.

These past few days, one of the member of the family got sick so she needs an additional fund to be used in paying the hospital bill. She visits GDMPC and apply a loan amounted to Php 3,000.00. She plans to engage into buy & sell (dried fish & procees meat ) business next year because she needs more income for her to give a better lives to her parents.

loans.use: to pay the hospital bill

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sharon works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Sharon is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to  buy additional spices like garlic, onions, pepper, salt and etc to sell.

Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices like garlic, onions, pepper, salt and etc to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman, 58 years old with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emma has a buy-and-sell oyster business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of oysters to sell.

She has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of oysters to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susana is 52 years old now.

Susana has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shoes, sandals, clothes, etc..

Susana has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shoes, sandals, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi is from Griboyedov village of Ejmiatsin region where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two little kids. 
Taguhi's family, has been involved in land cultivation. 
They mainly cultivate wheat and sell it in the local markets. 
To be able to enlarge cultivation of wheat and gather more harvest, Taguhi requested this loan. She asks lenders to support her purchase  wheat seeds and cover cultivation costs to sustain the farm and have rich harvest. 
Taguhi hopes to sell the harvest with good price in winter and get income for her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds and cover cultivation costs to sustain the farm and have rich harvest

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell tobacco business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Nancy is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more tobacco to sell for her buy and sell tobacco business.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to sell

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 56 year old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son, who is a rickshaw driver by profession.

Shakeela's son has been using an auto rickshaw for his transportation services for the last six years. However, for a while now his rickshaw has not been working properly because of all the use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order and wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. Due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

Shakeela has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his transportation business. Shakeela is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: St. David Horticultural Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Victoria. She is 23 years old and blessed with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development training.

She operates a shop. She is applying for her first Kiva loan to add stock by buying flour, sugar, drinking water, and other household items. She says this will enable her meet her customer’s demand.

She appreciates Kiva and their lenders and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to add stock to her shop by buying things like flour, sugar, drinking water, and other household items to meet customer's demands

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumalia is aged 40, mother of three children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well his relatives like to purchase from his general store. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well.

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Shumalia hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents and biscuits for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en: Jameela is 43 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving this rickshaw for many years to meet their family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance in order to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Jameela has contacted with Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband is able to repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston and one wheel as well as to pay the labor cost over it. This will help him drive more smoothly and to provide better transportation services for his passengers. Jameela is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his rickshaw's engine piston and one wheel as well as to pay the labor cost over it.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 54 year old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. Shaheen has been running a general store for the past 12 years, and she is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. She wants to purchase different kinds of commodities for business purposes: rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items. But due to financial constraints she is not in a position to buy all above these products for reselling. 

Therefore Shaheen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to buy all these commodities and will also help her to earn maximum profit to manage the household and the business. 

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy items to increase her general store business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop selling second hand clothes in the market. She started to do this business since a few years ago, with her own working capital. Amelia is earning a good income from selling her second clothes because many people like to buy it as it is cheap and unique if compared to new clothes. She is happy to do her business, because her business enable her to help her husband. Amelia is taking this loan because she wants to buy more second hand clothes, according to peoples likes, such as shorts, rubber pants, shirts, turtleneck shirts, nightgowns, skirts and others.

loans.use: to buy shorts, rubber pants, shirts, turtleneck shirts, nightgowns, skirts and others.

loans.name: Kimuki Farmers United Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Esther; she is married and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has undergone training on enterprise development and financial management. She has benefited a lot from the training and was able to start a green grocer business.

Esther also does bananas and vegetable farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to diversify her business. This will enable her earn more income that will help her provide better food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizer which will increase income to provide better food for her family and pay education fees for her children.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es: Beatriz de 33 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de sus tres hijos 2 varones de 2 años de edad y una hija de 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida típica y además posee un criadero de pescados tilapia, negocios con los que genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos brindado todos los insumos básicos y necesarios para ellos, además de llevar el sustento al hogar. Beatriz desea en cementar el corredor de su casa ya que por el momento es de tierra, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, mano de obra, etc. Para realizar el encementado del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 33 years old and lives in her own home accompanied by her three kids, 2 boys who are 2 years old and a 13 year old girl. She's a hardworking woman who sells traditional dishes and also owns a tilapia fish hatchery. These businesses generate the income that she has used to support her kids and provide them with all of the basic necessities, as well as sustain her household.

Beatriz wants to pave her home's hallway since it's currently dirt, and this is why she's applying for a FUSAI loan to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, labor etc. This is for paving her home's hallway.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, labor, etc. This is for paving her home's hallway.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
HEIDY continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional (sentada al centro izquierda, viste polera y short celeste).  El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando utensilios de cocina como cuchillos, cucharones, cubiertos y otros, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio trabajo todo el tiempo. Actualmente la banca sigue unida, los negocios de los socios mejoraron, pudieron comprar materia prima para sus actividades, realizaron el pago de servicios y mejoraron sus ambientes de trabajo. La venta de comida sigue siendo a diario, los clientes aumentaron en cantidad y la comida mejoró en ventas, la comida popular de moda son las ‘jkaras’ que son chuletas de cerdo acompañadas con mote, yuca y cuero frito, son muy populares los fines de semana, “cocino lo que los clientes me piden, este plato nuevo de cerdo es el preferido de los fines de semana, no lo cambio hasta que pase la moda…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque cocina comida popular que los clientes solicitan. La ventaja de su negocio es que cocina comida de moda, la desventaja es la falta de sillas y mesas plásticas para atender a sus clientes. Su sueño es establecer su negocio y vender mucha comida, ella desea comprar muebles de comedor para atender a sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que HEIDY solicita un préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas plásticas para que coman más clientes.
texts.en:
Heidy continues with her business selling traditional food. (She is seated in the left center, wearing the light blue shirt and shorts). 

She invested the loan that she obtained before by buying cooking utensils such as knives, ladles, cutlery and others. She has repaid her loan on time because her business was working all of the time.

Currently, the communal bank continues united, the members' businesses improved, they could buy raw materials for their activities, they completed payment for services and improved their working environments. 

The food sales business continues daily, the customers have grown in number, and the food sales have improved. The popular food is "jkaras", which is pork chops served with corn, fried yuca (cassava) and pork skins. This is very popular during weekends. "I cook with my customers request. This new pork dish is preferred during the weekends. I won't change until the trend is over", she says.

Her business is successful because she cooks popular food that her customers request. The advantage of her business is that she cooks food that is popular. The disadvantage is the lack of plastic chairs and tables to serve her customers. Her dream is to establish her business, and sell a lot of food. She wishes to buy dining furniture to serve her customers. 

This is the second sequence of loans with the institution, in the 4 years of this activity. It is for that reason that Heidy is requesting a loan to buy plastic tables and chairs, so that more customers can eat.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs, so that more customers can eat.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Erlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Erlyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables and other materials for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlyn has been sustaining her activities through her previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 29 years old and married. Jocelyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock. Jocelyn has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for raising her livestock

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure services. Marites is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 36 years old and married. She has three children, and two of them are in school.

Nida is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nida has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Salvadora Maricriz Del Carmen

texts.es: Salvadora de 29 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar en compañía de sus padres a quienes con mucho esfuerzo les brinda su apoyo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida gracias a que posee una pequeña tienda y además vende ropa ambulantemente es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los provee el sustento para su hogar y el pago de los servicios básicos. Salvadora desea invertir en su negocio adquiriendo más variedad de productos y poder surtir su tienda así como comprar ropa y zapatos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: compra de más variedad de ropa, nuevos estilos de zapatos además comprar frijoles, maíz, arroz, azúcar, bebidas envasadas, golosinas, etc., para ofrecerles más variedad de productos a sus clientes y poder generar mayores ingresos económicos que le permitan que su negocio vaya creciendo.
texts.en:
Salvadora is 29 years old and lives in the family home accompanied by her parents, who she supports through lots of effort. She's a hardworking woman who makes a living thanks to the fact that she owns a small store and additionally sells clothes as a street vendor. This is how she generates the income to provide for her home and pay for basic services.

Salvadora wants to invest in her business by acquiring a greater variety of products so that she can stock her store and also buy clothes and shoes. That's why she's applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: buying a greater variety of clothes, new styles of shoes and additionally buy beans, corn, rice, sugar, bottled beverages, sweets, etc.

loans.use: To invest in: a variety of clothes, new styles of shoes, buy beans, rice, sugar, bottled beverages, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Josephine. She operates her own sari-sari store (a Filipino-coined term for a small variety store) for a living. The store is occupying a small space of their humble house in Cavite. Operating for many years now, she has managed to keep the business running and growing.

Josephine has been faithful in her responsibilities and once again she is knocking on the hearts of the ever supportive lenders. By borrowing a supporting capital, she believes this could resolve her inadequacies in business. She hopes to improve her inventory by adding more grocery items like bottled water, sacks of rice, beverages, cooking oil and other common commodities.
